commit_message:
Use SVG graphics in HTML docs

 * Pre-convert SVG images to PDF with Inkscape

 * Do not pre-convert SVG to JPG, let Sphinx choose the best image
   format (SVG or PDF)

 * Optimize diagram scaling for consistent font sizing and clean PDF
   layouts

Change-Id: I22285f5284f3c396ebe98392fca3dc731b01d6fa

commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: Idcc32f7191df85eaac35f4f07256847b677b27fe

commit_message:
Enable live migrations with Ceph

* Add a new ceph user and pool for ephemeral drive storage
* Update nova configuration
* Open required libvirt ports
* Restrict VNC traffic to management network

Note that this is now aware of the way that Debian-based platforms configure

commit_message:
Keystone Verify - Further clarity on the use of ADMIN_PASS

A user reported an issue that the documentation was not clear as to where
the "ADMIN_PASS" paramater came from. I've clarified this further and
added a link to the relevant step to enforce it's origin. Also corrected
a very minor typo.

Note that this is now aware of the way that Debian-based platforms configure
the users in Keystone and links to the relevant page for further assistance.

Change-Id: Ie1722812386591fa0563b57a4127b0042da1ee40
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1252281
(cherry picked from commit 6dc666cef773fafa0ff632664a7641ab75872525)

commit_message:
Deny API requests where context doesn't match path

We shouldn't overwrite the context tenant_id (which comes from the
scope of the auth_token) with that from the path, instead raise a
HTTPForbidden exception if the path-provided tenant_id doesn't match
the context.

Change-Id: Ib6fb9881103312f7492081a20178f12309f35d81
Closes-Bug: #1256983

commit_message:
Fix broken argument name in v2 volume extend routine

The new_size attribute was misspelled, causing the volume extend
operation to fail with:

    ERROR: 'Namespace' object has no attribute 'new_size'

This happens only with the v2 API, v1 works fine.

Change-Id: Icb6b5008dad229f21e7906d9b5342d41f5e760cd
Closes-Bug: #1259552

subject: Reset-state and snapshot-reset-state for multiple objects
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-03 00:02:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Reset-state and snapshot-reset-state for multiple objects

This allows a user to call reset-state or snapshot-reset-state on a
list of objects.  The behavior is modeled after a similar change to
delete multiple volumes.

$ cinder reset-state good_volume good_volume_2
<no output>

Error behavior is as follows:

One success/one failure:
$ cinder reset-state good_volume asdf
Reset state for volume asdf failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'asdf' exists.

One failure:
$ cinder reset-state asdf
ERROR: Reset state for volume asdf failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'asdf' exists.

Two failures:
$ cinder reset-state asdf qwert
Reset state for volume asdf failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'asdf' exists.
Reset state for volume qwert failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'qwert' exists.
ERROR: Unable to reset the state for any of the specified volumes.

Related-Bug: 1241941
Change-Id: Id0a36fb7de0d69be0dac98ea04e4708775250b7a
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-03 00:11:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Reset-state and snapshot-reset-state for multiple objects

This allows a user to call reset-state or snapshot-reset-state on a
list of objects.  The behavior is modeled after a similar change to
delete multiple volumes.

$ cinder reset-state good_volume good_volume_2
<no output>

Error behavior is as follows:

One success/one failure:
$ cinder reset-state good_volume asdf
Reset state for volume asdf failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'asdf' exists.

One failure:
$ cinder reset-state asdf
ERROR: Reset state for volume asdf failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'asdf' exists.

Two failures:
$ cinder reset-state asdf qwert
Reset state for volume asdf failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'asdf' exists.
Reset state for volume qwert failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'qwert' exists.
ERROR: Unable to reset the state for any of the specified volumes.

Related-Bug: 1241941

Change-Id: Id0a36fb7de0d69be0dac98ea04e4708775250b7a

This allows a user to call reset-state or snapshot-reset-state on a

commit_message:
Reset-state and snapshot-reset-state for multiple objects

This allows a user to call reset-state or snapshot-reset-state on a
list of objects.  The behavior is modeled after a similar change to
delete multiple volumes.

$ cinder reset-state good_volume good_volume_2
<no output>

Error behavior is as follows:

One success/one failure:
$ cinder reset-state good_volume asdf
Reset state for volume asdf failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'asdf' exists.

One failure:
$ cinder reset-state asdf
ERROR: Reset state for volume asdf failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'asdf' exists.

Two failures:
$ cinder reset-state asdf qwert
Reset state for volume asdf failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'asdf' exists.
Reset state for volume qwert failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'qwert' exists.
ERROR: Unable to reset the state for any of the specified volumes.

Related-Bug: 1241941
Closes-Bug: 1256069
Change-Id: Id0a36fb7de0d69be0dac98ea04e4708775250b7a

commit_message:
Fix mysqldump backup and restore

* Move innobackupex logic out of backupagent
* Re-directing stderr for mysqldump command
* Using sudo for mysqldump restore command

Closes-Bug: 1239408

Change-Id: I0d2b82f2a970f154dfd78671abd323e103758984

commit_message:
Removing IDE specific ignores

Reasons
- .gitignore contains IDE specific ignores
- IDE specific ignores should be setup using
  global gitignore on local box.
  for eg. create a .gitignore locally and use ...
  git config --global core.excludesfile .gitignore

Changes
- Removed .idea generated by IntelliJ.
- Removed .DS_Store generated by Mac OS.
- Removed .project generated by Eclipse.
- Removed .pydevproject generated by PyDev.
- Removed atlassian-ide-plugin.xml
  generated by Atlassian IDE.

Change-Id: I902e980834716edb8a30ca58df520fd3fc0f73aa
Closes-Bug: #1257279

commit_message:
Updates trove-guestagent.conf.sample

Reason:
- Parameter service_registry_ext has been replaced
  by datastore_registry_ext.
- trove-guestagent.conf.sample contains
  service_registry_ext, should be
  datastore_registry_ext instead.

Changes:
- Updates service_registry_ext to
  datastore_registry_ext in
  trove-guestagent.conf.sample.

Closes-Bug: #1260294

commit_message:
Enabling H403, H702 rules

Reasons
- Currently H403, H702 rules are ignored
- Project has files violating H403, H702 rules.

Changes
- Enables H403, H702 rules.
- Updates the code not following H403, H702 rules.

Change-Id: Ie6f289bf10ee6d6c61feeee0d9905361f236813b
Closes-Bug: #1258592

commit_message:
Fixes trove help command

Reason:
- trove help output misplaces the position of "<subcommand> ..."
  from bottom to top.
- This behavior is because of formatting done to
  Print positionals before optionals.

Changes:
- Sequence fixed in trove help output.

Change-Id: I8aff2eec9f915a7ec1960b67ee7ba8423624aad6
Closes-Bug: #1260332

commit_message:
Fix the amount of workers spawned for non proxies

We were running as auto so swift would spawn a lot of processes
consuming memory and CPU which are not really neeeded in a devstack env
(and bad for the jenkins vm).

Closes-Bug: 1259548
Change-Id: I6b5266186168fe99568dda5453b436c2f9cfedb3

commit_message:
give a fullscreen attribute to workflow, for modal view

starting implementation of
http://ask-openstackux.rhcloud.com/question/11/modals-and-supporting-different-screen-sizes/

add a fullscreen attribute on Workflow (default to false)
use the fullscreen class in workflow template if True
add .modal.fullscreen rule in horizon.less
add documentation of the fullscreen attribute on WorkFlowView

Change-Id: Idc0e3a36e47cef1da6ef70cdfe589d74d040c361

commit_message:
Add the driver name to get stats log output

When the manager call tries to update the driver
stats, it checks to ensure the driver is initialized.
When the driver hasn't been initialized, it logs
a warning without the driver name.  This is confusing
for multiple backends.   This patch adds the driver
name, version and the config group name, to the log output,
so the admin can see which driver is failing.

Change-Id: I82e8aa969e7baa55db9c8dddc1c08db2a1a41091
Closes-Bug: #1259279

commit_message:
API: Validate and normalize address

On the API side, checks whether the supplied MAC address is formally
correct and normalize it to all lower case.

The patch also improves the docstring of the is_valid_mac function.

Change-Id: I6ae13888a9e17a10bba20acf829cbd01df535a3c
Closes-Bug: #1259269

commit_message:
test code should be excluded from test coverage summary

Since the recent movement of the test code directory, now entire test
code is included in the test coverage summary, it makes a rather
strange loop, test code in the summary also shows being tested or
not tested. This patch will fix the problem so that the test
coverage summary will not show the coverage percentage for test code.

Change-Id: Ibbb4a009f01515befdd7045d6eec1afaf24ca99f

Reverting the change to the trove.test.conf so that the tox tests are
not so verbose with all the logging when running through the tests. It
makes it very difficult to find out what failed and where without much
groking of the output.

This was a change i made so that when you do a './redstack start-fake'
it would show the logs in the screen session. But this turned out to be
a bad idea when running in tox.

", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
use_stderr should be False for tox tests

Reverting the change to the trove.test.conf so that the tox tests are
not so verbose with all the logging when running through the tests. It
makes it very difficult to find out what failed and where without much
groking of the output.

This was a change i made so that when you do a './redstack start-fake'
it would show the logs in the screen session. But this turned out to be
a bad idea when running in tox.

Change-Id: I236b2de2e89e49fd937d917d2955fddb5fb35d6f

commit_message:
Install Guide: add a chapter about client commands

This new chapter is taken from the common/ section, and explains how to
install clients on machines outside the OpenStack cluster. The install
guide can be misleading about how to use clients to administrate the
cloud, adding this section will hopefully help clarifying this.

pom.xml is modified to add an audience target (installer), used to build
specific parts of the common files.

backport: none
Change-Id: Ib4187d86bb2e3d7d9a26df426e17b4f4039a90fa

commit_message:
Updating unit test assertions

Reason:
- unit tests contains next assertions:
 assertThat with  matcher;
 assert isinstance(a, b) instead of assertIsInstance(value, type).
 assertTrue(a in b), instead of assertIn(a, b), assertNotIn.
 assertEqual(v, None), instead of assertIsNone or assertIsNotNone.
 testtools.ExceptionExpected (made for Py2.5 compability) changed to assertRaises

Changes:
- updating assertions.

Change-Id: Ifec29f8da68a906f2a1a0abae6a74d5920f0eac6
Closes-Bug: 1259938

commit_message:
Resource tracking ignores used disk and memory

The resource tracking would not take into account the actual used
disk and memory stats from the host.

If the returned memory or disk space is greater than the
statically configured memory or disk space then a warning message
will be logged so that the administrator can address this accordingly.

Change-Id: I9f093c8eb0fdf6951121e54fd8ef9a72cc2bf117
Closes-Bug: #1242645

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-18 19:36:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add simple application interface and object registry

solum/objects/__init__.py supports loading and initializing a set of
associations between public interfaces (solum/objects/application.py,
etc) and private implementations.  By default, backends are loaded
as packages, with a load() method on the package module expected to
handle invoking solum/objects/base#register_obj_class for each
implementation.  A new config flag "backend" is loaded under the
"database" group to represent the persistence backend type.

The common exception and initialization code is based on nova commit
93efad46aa1cbb9aef68561aca49278ef7584983, with slight tweaks for
Solum.

commit_message:
Add simple application interface and object registry

solum/objects/__init__.py supports loading and initializing a set of
associations between public interfaces (solum/objects/application.py,
etc) and private implementations. By default, backends are loaded
as packages, with a load() method on the package module expected to
handle invoking solum.objects.registry.put(name,cls) for each
implementation. A new config flag "backend" is loaded under the
"database" group to represent the persistence backend type.

The common exception and initialization code is based on nova commit
93efad46aa1cbb9aef68561aca49278ef7584983, with slight tweaks for
Solum.

Change-Id: If33965825ce4978106e7021d62b16688d28fa29e

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 6449, 'name': 'Chris Jones', 'email': 'cmsj@tenshu.net', 'username': 'cmsj'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7419, 'name': 'Imre Farkas', 'email': 'farkas.imre@gmail.com', 'username': 'ifarkas'}, {'_account_id': 7585, 'name': 'Ladislav Smola', 'email': 'lsmola@redhat.com', 'username': 'lsmola'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-09 13:01:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Quieten disk-image-get-kernel

disk-image-get-kernel is pretty noisey and you see e.g.:

  $> load-image overcloud-compute.qcow2
  XXX  -d '/tmp/image.lWGCgPoj' -o 'tmp' -i '/home/stack/overcloud-compute.qcow2' --
  Extracting kernel + ramdisk from /home/stack/overcloud-compute.qcow2 and writing them to /tmp/image.lWGCgPoj
  nbd                    17554  0
  nbd                    17554  0
  basename: missing operand
  Try 'basename --help' for more information.
  /dev/nbd0 disconnected
  tmp-vmlinuz,tmp-initrd

Clean all this up so we just get:

  $> load-image overcloud-compute.qcow2
  Extracting kernel + ramdisk from /home/stack/overcloud-compute.qcow2 to tmp-vmlinuz and tmp-initrd in /tmp/image.g6b0lG88

Change-Id: I8971ec0bbcd87157b07fc17254c56bb9f9f2a597

commit_message:
Quieten disk-image-get-kernel

disk-image-get-kernel is pretty noisy and you see e.g.:

  $> load-image overcloud-compute.qcow2
  XXX  -d '/tmp/image.lWGCgPoj' -o 'tmp' -i '/home/stack/overcloud-compute.qcow2' --
  Extracting kernel + ramdisk from /home/stack/overcloud-compute.qcow2 and writing them to /tmp/image.lWGCgPoj
  nbd                    17554  0
  nbd                    17554  0
  basename: missing operand
  Try 'basename --help' for more information.
  /dev/nbd0 disconnected
  tmp-vmlinuz,tmp-initrd

Clean all this up so we just get:

  $> load-image overcloud-compute.qcow2
  Extracting kernel + ramdisk from /home/stack/overcloud-compute.qcow2 to tmp-vmlinuz and tmp-initrd in /tmp/image.g6b0lG88

Change-Id: I8971ec0bbcd87157b07fc17254c56bb9f9f2a597

commit_message:
vmware driver selection of vm_folder_ref.

causes the vmFolder target in vCenter to be calculated based on the datastore selected

fixes bug: 1214850
addresses bug: 1180044

Change-Id: Iadde4c5e10bdeaa24aac3ecde278fe992a89be4b

commit_message:
Handle DBDuplicateEntry on Ports with same address

Handle the DBDuplicateEntry exception when creating/updating ports with
the same address and raise MACAlreadyExists to give user a better feedback
about the problem.

Change-Id: I87feb27776bb2fee2a4a6b28f9468e235063f5f7
Closes-Bug: #1257673

commit_message:
Move to stackforge

Update URLs in the documentation for the source and
bug tracker.

Add a .gitreview file to make reviews work.

Change the "style" tox env to "pep8" to be consistent with
the check job expectations.

commit_message:
Implementing scalable Mistral Engine

* Asynchronous tasks
* Separate stateless task executors
* Notification of task executors via RabbitMQ

TODO:
* DB transaction management
* Analyzing graph of tasks to identify what should be started
* Thorough automated tests

Partially implements blueprint: mistral-poc
Partially implements blueprint: mistral-workflow-execution
Partially implements blueprint: mistral-engine-ha

Change-Id: I022e1b73b9a3c58f1fbc259ba3e5995acd2bf6c3

commit_message:
Add extra swift features

Enable various swift middleware and options, a default tempest run is
expecting these to be present. With these changes all of the swift
tempest tests pass.

Also reordered the sections in proxy-server.conf to match the pipeline
order and removed the proxy-logging section which was unused.

Change-Id: I12406d5b64fb4595a0498abb8d50d2e33f88a147

subject: Cosmetic change to cleanup output
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 12:45:41.000000000', 'files': ['rally/benchmark/utils.py'], 'message': 'Cosmetic change to cleanup output

Cleanup failures turned out to be a pretty common thing since there may be
dozens of different cloud configurations and it is not trivial to implement
a single cleanup strategy that would work for all of them. This patch makes
the log output in case of a cleanup failure somewhat less affright.

Change-Id: Ibff9edaada9b8a6d69575d6702ab6ea4f2192f8a
Related-Bug: #1260059
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Cosmetic change to cleanup output

Cleanup failures turned out to be a pretty common thing since there may be
dozens of different cloud configurations and it is not trivial to implement
a single cleanup strategy that would work for all of them. This patch makes
the log output in case of a cleanup failure somewhat less affright.

Change-Id: Ibff9edaada9b8a6d69575d6702ab6ea4f2192f8a
Related-Bug: #1260059

There is no code use the config item `host_state_interval`, so remove it.

Change-Id: Ieb047ccb33cdecc6f25b6ae128dcac4e1c00cd98
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-11-27 05:10:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove unused flag 'host_state_interval'

Patch I749204d7d6461993d0c42bf5877b65c5ec17c62f remove periodic task
`_report_driver_status()`, which fanout this host's capabilities to
nova scheduler. So the flag 'host_state_interval' is no used.
Just remove it in this patch.

DocImpact: the 'host_state_interval' flag has been removed

Change-Id: Ieb047ccb33cdecc6f25b6ae128dcac4e1c00cd98
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-11-28 01:38:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove unused flag 'host_state_interval'

Patch I749204d7d6461993d0c42bf5877b65c5ec17c62f remove periodic task
`_report_driver_status()`, which fanout this host's capabilities to
nova scheduler. So the flag 'host_state_interval' is not used.
Just remove it in this patch.

DocImpact: the 'host_state_interval' flag has been removed. It was last used in
grizzly and was not used in havana.

Change-Id: Ieb047ccb33cdecc6f25b6ae128dcac4e1c00cd98
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2013-11-28 15:05:20.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Remove unused flag 'host_state_interval'

`_report_driver_status()`, which fanout this host's capabilities to
nova scheduler. So the flag 'host_state_interval' is not used.

Change-Id: Ieb047ccb33cdecc6f25b6ae128dcac4e1c00cd98
", 'number': 4}]
commit_message:
Remove unused flag 'host_state_interval'

Patch I749204d7d6461993d0c42bf5877b65c5ec17c62f removed periodic task
`_report_driver_status()`, which fanout this host's capabilities to
nova scheduler. So the flag 'host_state_interval' is not used.
Just remove it in this patch.

DocImpact: the 'host_state_interval' flag has been removed. It was last used in
grizzly and was not used in havana.

Change-Id: Ieb047ccb33cdecc6f25b6ae128dcac4e1c00cd98

subject: Fix comparison with singletons
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 13:48:23.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_dbinstance.py', 'heat/tests/test_environment.py', 'heat/tests/test_nested_stack.py', 'heat/tests/test_eip.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance.py', 'heat/tests/test_api_openstack_v1.py', 'heat/tests/test_neutron_security_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_cw_alarm.py', 'heat/tests/test_api_cloudwatch.py', 'heat/tests/test_attributes.py', 'heat/tests/test_neutron_firewall.py', 'heat/tests/test_neutron_loadbalancer.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_loadbalancer.py', 'heat/tests/test_metadata_refresh.py', 'heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/tests/test_cloudwatch.py', 'heat/tests/test_loguserdata.py', 'heat/tests/test_autoscaling.py', 'heat/tests/test_event.py', 'heat/tests/test_api_cfn_v1.py', 'heat/tests/test_neutron.py', 'heat/tests/test_neutron_vpnservice.py'], 'message': 'Fix comparison with singletons

Many plases in tests code use assertEqual(AA, None),
the same with True and False and negatives of such comparisons.

As comparison to singletons must use `is` operator, appropriate usage
is assertIs, assertIsNot, assertIsNone, assertIsNotNone

These assertions are provided by the `testtools` package,
so this change is not breaking backward compatibility with Python 2.6

This first patch inlcudes roughly half of the files touched by these changes
(up to and including test_n*) to ease the review.

Partial-Bug: #1259023

Change-Id: Id6454e872d5147e1fa05a528dea3c17ee9b6262d
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix comparison with singletons

Many plases in tests code use assertEqual(AA, None),
the same with True and False and negatives of such comparisons.

As comparison to singletons must use `is` operator, appropriate usage
is assertIs, assertIsNot, assertIsNone, assertIsNotNone

These assertions are provided by the `testtools` package,
so this change is not breaking backward compatibility with Python 2.6

This first patch inlcudes roughly half of the files touched by these changes
(up to and including test_n*) to ease the review.

Partial-Bug: #1259023

Change-Id: Id6454e872d5147e1fa05a528dea3c17ee9b6262d

commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb

commit_message:
Add clean configuration files to upgrade from H to I

Any new configurations for Icehouse should go in one of the upgrade files in
from-havana directory.
Also moves {BASE,TARGET}_RELEASE vars forward to Havana->Icehouse pair.

Change-Id: Iac520a8de4c3b9f14e2289cfb9b6a50c4ab0ce32

commit_message:
added selective node deployment/provisioning

Detailed description
* added node selection on deployment/provisioning actions
  e.g. downloading/uploading of facts for specific nodes
  rather than downloading facts for all nodes
* fixed spelling

Implements: blueprint cli-separate-rpovisioning-and-deployment

Change-Id: I5eb3fca4cd3e0cd7db8bf573c321d4b3db93524a

commit_message:
Fix for doc formatting bug and small update to ISO build doc

Closes-Bug: #1260246

We need to remove nodejs and nodejs-legacy packages before installing nodejs
from the PPA repo in order to avoid conflicts with old system packages.
We also should not try to install "npm" package since it's a part of new nodejs

Change-Id: I5a5386317ba3ab8915bf0da089eab12e499fdb5a

commit_message:
Fix wrong vif driver by default

Some changes have been done in Nova to have generic drivers:
http://tinyurl.com/VifDriver

This patchs aims to:
- Change default driver
- Rename unit tests files for using Neutron name instead of Quantum (depcrecated)

Closes-bug 1259139
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
Change-Id: I6dd7766a1f99221927d3143d14da80fb0be16211

commit_message:
Fixing neutron::server connection parameter

Previously, neutron::server's (deprecated) sql_connection parameter
had a default value, preventing the new/preferred connection
parameter from ever being used.

This change removes that default, permitting the connection
parameter to work properly, and extends unit tests to confirm.

bug introduced at commit 82552e79316a4ffc1c879dd3aaa1f4735a4a35a0,
change I300fc12092bca1abdd105e0c0c272f7fd49258ac

Change-Id: I116b482c620b5c44b88c1b801438a100343f6f9f

commit_message:
Fix attribute error in adapter

On python 2.6 module unittests do not have
SkipTest attribute - it is available only on 2.7

Also delete initialization of ceilometer client,
according it broke all ostf in case if ceilometer do
not installed

Change-Id: Iefc302e4d6860b3e3ce6951902c166b197257175
Close-bug: bug/1260199

Change default API auth to keystone-based

Current default setting of auth_strategy=noauth
is not a sane default for our users.

Switch to keystone-based authentication.

commit_message:
Added keystone auth port to the nova config

Added the $KEYSTONE_AUTH_PORT to the keystone_authtoken
section of the create_nova_conf function.
This is required as without it nova doesn't communicate
to the keystone server. Generating an "Unauthorised (HTTP 401)"
page when acceesing /admin/.

Change-Id: Ibf4d9d1c21081a1e3de4ea765f4db6de5fbdb237

commit_message:
Qemu emulator requires at least 128MB of memory to boot on ppc64

The default nano and micro flavors need more memory to boot on
ppc64. New flavors are 128MB and 256MB, respectively.
Trailing spaces removed, again.

Change-Id: Ic6740bda959754380982e67f753876dc6d984685

subject: Fixes python-swiftclient debugging message
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-11 12:16:18.000000000', 'files': ['swiftclient/client.py'], 'message': 'Fixes python-swiftclient debugging message

Appends the container's name to the URL displayed, to be used to
replay the queries with curl.

Replaying the curl commands displayed by "swift --debug list
<container>" now works properly.

Example:
$ swift --debug list test-container
...
DEBUG:swiftclient:REQ: curl -i http://10.0.48.134:8080/v1/AUTH_6c554b8dd3d74e44878eddb92caf8687/test-container?format=json -X GET -H ...
...

Change-Id: I7ec33d185fedc44a529c016d38f841fde39d20d0
Closes-Bug: #1238612
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixes python-swiftclient debugging message

Appends the container's name to the URL displayed, to be used to
replay the queries with curl.

Replaying the curl commands displayed by "swift --debug list
<container>" now works properly.

Example:
$ swift --debug list test-container
...
DEBUG:swiftclient:REQ: curl -i http://10.0.48.134:8080/v1/AUTH_6c554b8dd3d74e44878eddb92caf8687/test-container?format=json -X GET -H ...
...

Change-Id: I7ec33d185fedc44a529c016d38f841fde39d20d0
Closes-Bug: #1238612

commit_message:
update documentation with specific of rax setup

because I spent way too long figuring this out, here is the patch
to describe what the various settings need to be to make this
work with rax cloud and upstream nova-client.

commit_message:
Clarified location of driver config settings; removed ESX driver reference; minor text edits.

UPDATED part 3: Build failed! fixed program listing tags
UPDATED part 2: Build failed. Checked and modified tag formatting.
UPDATED: Removed tabs and applied correct use of <filename> tags.

* Clarified details of volume driver configuration settings for VMDK drivers in nova.conf and cinder.conf.

* Removed reference to ESX/ESXi server driver config because it has not been extensively tested.

* Changed occurrences of "data store" to "datastore" for consistency.

Change-Id: I2a45b131fa19749530f5fe93115518f8b9f4ea4e
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1260005

commit_message:
TTL mechanism support with expirer service

Aims to support a TTL mechanism for data entering Ceilometer
collector database.
TTL is very useful to configure when getting a lot of meters.

implement blueprint ttl-support
Change-Id: I9d98e8b833ad94fd79722dee7226e7f4f03aaa2e
(cherry picked from commit 0af224916f085166d5ccd104e90cbc680039063d)
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

subject: allow configdrive vs. metadata server to be configured
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-01 22:25:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'allow configdrive vs. metadata server to be configured

this gives us control of the config drive settings in devstack so
that we can force it off, to ensure that we are using the
metadata server instead for configuring the guests.

Needed because neutron does some extra clever things with the
metadata server setup which got broken because we were defaulting
to config drive in all the runs.

Change-Id: Ib203bb0c812939f32b36731464b18566a187c85a

commit_message:
allow configdrive vs. metadata server to be configured

this gives us control of the config drive settings in devstack so
that we can force it off, to ensure that we are using the
metadata server instead for configuring the guests.

Needed because neutron does some extra clever things with the
metadata server setup which got broken because we were defaulting
to config drive in all the runs.

Depends-On: Ic2acb568b55a05b84120b181383ea45ea190dcad

Change-Id: Ib203bb0c812939f32b36731464b18566a187c85a

commit_message:
Don't dd bytes to thin LVM for clone operations

In Cinder to clone a volume we typically take a snapshot
of an LVM, create a new volume and dd the contents of the
snap to the new volume, then delete the snap.

For linear LVM this is fine because there's a signficant
performance penalty for having snapshots of an LVM volume.

With LVM thin however this isn't the case as all the data blocks
are shared in the pool.  This means we can create and actually use
snapshots, and delete parent LV's without issue.

This change implements the use of snapshots for operations like
clone (create from volume) and create from snapshot.  Rather than
do the intermediate snapshot and dd, we just create an LVM snapshot
with the volume properties and use it.

Change-Id: I9c7a06168dba97d1477e9500e2651c3f8a44b42a
Closes-Bug: #1224671

commit_message:
Add eclipse project files to .gitignore

Like some of the other projects(nova,cinder,glance,heat,oslo),
git ignores eclipse project files(.project, .pydevproject).

This will remove manual steps for developing from eclipse.

Fixes bug: 1257616

Change-Id: I6f36196190b1878843a6d8e706bba8d6d958c282

subject: Stale kvm processes when using libguestfs
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-03 22:13:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/disk/vfs/guestfs.py', 'nova/virt/disk/api.py'], 'message': 'Stale kvm processes when using libguestfs

When setting up images for nova there is insufficient error handling
when using libguestfs which leaves stale kvm processes on the compute
node.  These stale processes consume CPU and memory and can starve a
compute node of resources.  The stale processes are not reaped when the
instance that triggered the libguestfs injection is deleted.

Change-Id: Ifae6900177ae402dd6c62c71c1fb4712562362d0
Partial-Bug: #1246852
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Stale kvm processes when using libguestfs

When setting up images for nova there is insufficient error handling
when using libguestfs which leaves stale kvm processes on the compute
node.  These stale processes consume CPU and memory and can starve a
compute node of resources.  The stale processes are not reaped when the
instance that triggered the libguestfs injection is deleted.

Change-Id: Ifae6900177ae402dd6c62c71c1fb4712562362d0
Partial-Bug: #1246852

Change-Id: Ib290f8df20a9e29ed98faec221f607b685e26da4
', 'number': 24}, {'created': '2013-09-23 16:35:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Ensure that instances_path is not world readable

It could be a slight security problem to let every user on the machine
see our image files. The simplest way to ensure that they cannot is to
make the instances_path readable, writable and executable only by the
group libvirt uses for spawning new instances.

Because this group depends on each distribution we add a new
configuration option called 'libvirt_group' to let packagers and admins
to specify such group. For example, Ubuntu and Debian use the group 'kvm'
while RHEL and Fedora use the group 'qemu'.

Marking as DocImpact because this new option should be documented to let
know the packagers and administrators how to fix the issue.

Fixes bug 1129748

Change-Id: Ib290f8df20a9e29ed98faec221f607b685e26da4
", 'number': 25}, {'created': '2013-09-25 11:53:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ensure that instances_path is not world readable

It could be a slight security problem to let every user on the machine
see our image files. With this patch the compute driver will take care
of changing the mode of the instances path so it is only readable by the
owner and set an adequate umask (0007) when creating the files for each
instance (disks, console log, ...).

This change also sets the executable flag for others to instances_path,
which is the only requirement so libvirt can access the contained files
for the instances.

Another issue with libvirt is that it sets the ownership of the images
to root after destroying the instance. This prevents further access from
nova if we have set previously a stric file mode. This patch will change
the ownership of those files to the nova user once the instance is destroyed.

Fixes bug 1129748

', 'number': 26}, {'created': '2013-09-25 13:03:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ensure that instances_path is not world readable

It could be a slight security problem to let every user on the machine
see our image files. With this patch the compute driver will take care
of changing the mode of the instances path so it is only readable by the
owner and set an adequate umask (0007) when creating the files for each
instance (disks, console log, ...).

This change also sets the executable flag for others to instances_path,
which is the only requirement so libvirt can access the contained files
for the instances.

Another issue with libvirt is that it sets the ownership of the images
to root after destroying the instance. This prevents further access from
nova if we have set previously a stric file mode. This patch will change
the ownership of those files to the nova user once the instance is destroyed.

Fixes bug 1129748

The files that nova shares with libvirt and QEMU may contain user
sensitive information and it might be a problem if those files are
visible for all the users in the machine. These files include the images
under instances_dir, the base images and snapshots.

This patch introduces a new decorator that will change the user
file-creation mask temporarily during the call of a method, allowing
us to mark methods that shouldn't create world readable files thus
protecting them.

have been modified to use rootwrap so they can still access these files

commit_message:
Ensure that libvirt files are not world readable

The files that nova shares with libvirt and QEMU may contain user
sensitive information and it might be a problem if those files are
visible for all the users in the machine. These files include the images
under instances_dir, the base images and snapshots.

This patch uses the decorator introduced in the previous patch, which
will change the user file-creation mask temporarily, during the call of
a method, allowing us to mark methods that shouldn't create world
readable files and thus, protecting them.

Also in this patch, all the calls that interact with libvirt owned files
have been modified to use rootwrap so they can still access these files
(for resizing or creating an image or when migrating an instance).

As a side effect, by setting the proper permissions to libvirt files and
accessing them using rootwrap, this patch avoids problems with cached file
attributes that might trigger problems as the one described in bug 1218372

Closes-Bug: #1129748
Closes-Bug: #1227027
Change-Id: Ib290f8df20a9e29ed98faec221f607b685e26da4

commit_message:
Properly mock out image_utils operations for tests

Currently image_utils unit tests write data to the
"conversion" path.  This should be mocked out rather than
interacting with the actual file system.

image_utils.temporary_file() also appears to hide OSErrors -- fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1252502

Change-Id: I3fcb6c4cb39de2f9f009be93498f89987be04241

commit_message:
Don't have tox install pre-release software

Override the tox pip install command to avoid using the "--pre" option
which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include pre-release and
development versions."  By default, pip will only install stable
versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: I3aa2a69c5bae54932137c78cc711236a0ca24602

commit_message:
Add -U to pip install command in tox.ini

Ask pip to upgrade packages in the virtualenv so that a long-lived
virtualenv is still kept up to date as external dependencies change.

Change-Id: I5a57debd5c4bc03e6d00d3801be614d9b895c508

commit_message:
db: make compatible with SQLAlchemy 0.8

Argument assert_unicode is deprecated in SQLAlchemy 0.7.
Also it is removed from SQLAlchemy 0.8.
Arguments convert_unicode, unicode_error, and _warn_on_bytestring
seem to cause problems with SQLAlchemy 0.8.

Closes-bug: 1235829

commit_message:
Extract suffix from req URL to avoid escaping dots

Usernames and their hosts can contain dots. As such,
user CRUD requests may end in ids that contain one
or more fullstops. Our request router can interpret
these as file suffixes and our methods and as a
result, truncates these ids improperly.

This change inspects the request object in these
cases, looks for a possibly misinterpreted suffix,
and reattaches the suffix to the id. This means
that escaping . in requests shouldn't be necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1252327

Change-Id: I74c4d6694baba44ebe0018eedac2ae5c4773b370

commit_message:
Set the provision_state to DEPLOYFAIL

Set the provision_state to DEPLOYFAIL instead of ERROR when the deploy
failed. The DEPLOYFAIL state should be used for this problem specific
where ERROR is more generic.

Change-Id: I87c75dd8be46950792643303f79d57f9a7da9d0d

subject: Clean up duplicated change-building code in objects
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-10 14:56:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Clean up duplicated change-building code in objects

Almost every object thus far has done this:

  updates = {}
  changes = self.obj_what_changed()
  for field in changes:
        updates[field] = self[field]

to get a dict of updates to apply to the database. This patch adds
that as part of the base object and makes every place that does
the above to just use that.

Change-Id: I8d2616ecc2c88cf4b21e7e8193f5b985407ed869
Closes-Bug: #1259527

  for field in changes:
        updates[field] = self[field]

to get a dict of updates to apply to the database. This patch adds

commit_message:
Clean up duplicated change-building code in objects

Almost every object thus far has done this:

  updates = {}
  changes = self.obj_what_changed()
  for field in changes:
        updates[field] = self[field]

to get a dict of updates to apply to the database. This patch adds
that as part of the base object and makes every place that does
the above to just use that.

It's a port from a patch in nova ,link to the origional patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/45353/

Change-Id: I8d2616ecc2c88cf4b21e7e8193f5b985407ed869
Closes-Bug: #1259527

Rework patch validation on Ports

This makes use of the complex type objects of WSME and creates a type
to validate json patch format.

commit_message:
Add JsonPatchType class

This patch adds the JsonPatchType class for API parameter validation with
WSME. This class will be used to replace some of the custom validation
functions we have in the api/utils.py.

Change-Id: I233cd273854eae5ed4d8856d4af3e2f8e2309dce
Partial-Bug: #1223847

commit_message:
Fix missing policy enforcement in CFN API

Currently the CreateStack and UpdateStack actions aren't correctly
enforcing the policy, so add calls to _enforce which fixes that,
and rework the test to illustrate the issue.

Change-Id: Ia5c2e65512ab9d1c163171f8617c081ab96745e5
Closes-Bug: #1256049

commit_message:
change sphinx requirement to < 1.1.99 because 1.2b3 exists

< 1.2 seems right, except 1.2b3 is also < 1.2 by python version
rules. In the gate, with the mirror, this seems to work. However
on local envirnments 1.2b3 is often pulled, and local doc builds
break.

Change-Id: I719536a0754bb532b800c52082aeb4e2033e174f

commit_message:
change sphinx requirement to < 1.1.99 because 1.2b3 exists

< 1.2 seems right, except 1.2b3 is also < 1.2 by python version
rules. In the gate, with the mirror, this seems to work. However
on local envirnments 1.2b3 is often pulled, and local doc builds
break.

Change-Id: I719536a0754bb532b800c52082aeb4e2033e174f

subject: Skip autoscaling test until more reliable
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-04 02:59:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Skip autoscaling test until more reliable

AutoScalingTest has issues which will require rethinking how
this test is implemented, including:
- the optimal ConsumeStopSeconds will depend on the overhead
  of boot time, which varies greatly between bare metal and
  virt-on-virt
- every combination of distro/release/flavor will result in a
  different baseline memory usage, making it difficult to
  determine the ScaleDownThreshold to set

This change skips this test and tracks against the bug:
Partial-Bug: #1257575

Change-Id: I0695a7efacdbeab39c895a97cb45496fcaf97e35

commit_message:
Skip autoscaling test until more reliable

AutoScalingTest has issues which will require rethinking how
this test is implemented, including:
- the optimal ConsumeStopSeconds will depend on the overhead
  of boot time, which varies greatly between bare metal and
  virt-on-virt
- every combination of distro/release/flavor will result in a
  different baseline memory usage, making it difficult to
  determine the ScaleDownThreshold to set

This change skips this test and tracks against the bug:
Partial-Bug: #1257575

Change-Id: I0695a7efacdbeab39c895a97cb45496fcaf97e35

subject: Workaround Cinder "wishlist" bug 1255593 for multi-backend volume_clear
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-07 21:54:05.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder'], 'message': 'Workaround Cinder "wishlist" bug 1255593 for multi-backend volume_clear

Cinder currently only applies the volume_clear setting from the DEFAULT
section of cinder.conf if you're using a single backend.

The Cinder team has determined this is a 'wishlist' item to propagate
volume_clear to each backend, but it does impact usability and
performance.

To improve the performance of running Tempest with multi-backends in the
gate, workaround the bug in devstack.

Related-Bug: #1255593

Change-Id: Ia0ff5422f53eeda9a3ac4336eefec3b9bdea6da2
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Workaround Cinder "wishlist" bug 1255593 for multi-backend volume_clear

Cinder currently only applies the volume_clear setting from the DEFAULT
section of cinder.conf if you're using a single backend.

The Cinder team has determined this is a 'wishlist' item to propagate
volume_clear to each backend, but it does impact usability and
performance.

To improve the performance of running Tempest with multi-backends in the
gate, workaround the bug in devstack.

Related-Bug: #1255593

Change-Id: Ia0ff5422f53eeda9a3ac4336eefec3b9bdea6da2

subject: Add X-Tenant-ID to metadata request
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 14:46:28.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/metadata/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_metadata_agent.py'], 'message': "Add X-Tenant-ID to metadata request

Previously, one could update a port's device_id to be that of
another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve that
instance's metadata. In order to prevent this X-Tenant-ID is now
passed in the metadata request to nova and nova then checks that
X-Tenant-ID also matches the tenant_id for the instance against it's
database to ensure it's not being spoofed.

DocImpact - When upgrading OpenStack nova and neturon, neutron
            should be updated first (and neutron-metadata-agent
            restarted before nova is upgraded) in order to minimize
            downtime. This is because there is also a patch to nova
            which has checks X-Tenant-ID against it's database
            therefore neutron-metadata-agent needs to pass that
            before nova is upgraded for metadata to work.

Change-Id: I2b8fa2f561a7f2914608e68133abf15efa95015a
Closes-Bug: #1235450
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add X-Tenant-ID to metadata request

Previously, one could update a port's device_id to be that of
another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve that
instance's metadata. In order to prevent this X-Tenant-ID is now
passed in the metadata request to nova and nova then checks that
X-Tenant-ID also matches the tenant_id for the instance against it's
database to ensure it's not being spoofed.

DocImpact - When upgrading OpenStack nova and neturon, neutron
            should be updated first (and neutron-metadata-agent
            restarted before nova is upgraded) in order to minimize
            downtime. This is because there is also a patch to nova
            which has checks X-Tenant-ID against it's database
            therefore neutron-metadata-agent needs to pass that
            before nova is upgraded for metadata to work.

Change-Id: I2b8fa2f561a7f2914608e68133abf15efa95015a
Closes-Bug: #1235450

commit_message:
move rpc_setup to the last step of __init__

rpc setup should be the last stuff in agent initialization
so that the rcp message handler(the agent instance itself)
can have a fully initialized agent instance.

Change-Id: I58c966e2c8ee92c307b565932e867b5d1ec73b67
Closes-Bug: #1259088

commit_message:
Use /info to check if SLO is enabled

The functional tests have some hokey detection of SLO support that
pre-dates the /info API, but we can do better now.

Also moved the SLO check up inside the setUp method so that skipping
the SLO tests should be somewhat faster now.

Change-Id: I645718b459d794a9a97770f7162934558c94f3e8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-31 17:40:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Debug env for tox

Running a test with pdb was difficult because testr captures
output and causes pdb prompt to quit.

This change adds a debug environment that runs
 python -m testtools.run discover --load-list test_to_run

as described in
 https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Testr#Debugging_.28pdb.29_Tests

Now you can do a command like

 tox -e debug keystone.tests.test_auth.AuthWithTrust.test_v3_trust_token_get_token_fails

and when it hits your breakpoint you'll get a prompt.

commit_message:
Debug env for tox

Running a test with pdb was difficult because testr captures
output and causes pdb prompt to quit.

Tips for how to run with debug are provided here:
 https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Testr#Debugging_.28pdb.29_Tests

This change puts these commands into a debug env in tox.ini so
you can do a command like

 tox -e debug test_v3_trust_token_get_token_fails

or, for more granularity:
 tox -e debug keystone.tests.test_sql_migrate_extensions.EndpointFilterExtension
 tox -e debug keystone.tests.test_sql_migrate_extensions.EndpointFilterExtension.test_downgrade

and when it hits your breakpoint you'll get the debug prompt.

Change-Id: I2b5dc81f4652dc89ecbcc7c785245a81cf77a1ca

commit_message:
Added help note in attach volume dialog

Added help note in Horizon's dashboard (Edit attachments dialog), in order to
inform that device name may not match the proposed one.
The intention is to provide more information when device names don't match due
to hypervisor limitations or naming convention.

Change-Id: I39828542047a2f2149815e2beba1099501aa755e
Partial-Bug: #1217874

commit_message:
Ensure api_paste_conf is an absolute path

If api_paste_conf is specified as a relative path and the directory from
where the nova-api service is started contains a file with the same
name, the wsgi loader won't try to find the absolute path to that file
which is required when not passing the base directory to the
paste.deploy library.

This change ensures the config_path is an absolute path so it can be
found by the paste.deploy library.

Closes-Bug: #1259183
Change-Id: I0eb6ef1d69d302634b8c842449f997ec10c13933

commit_message:
Make obj_from_primitive() preserve version information

When we hydrate an object from a remote client, we need to know
the version and not pretend like it's just the current version.

Related-Bug: #1258256
Change-Id: I68bbfa18addfb7e51efc10a757135e338302a787

commit_message:
Explicitly define "auth_region" in Neutron metadata_agent.ini

The default value for "auth_region" assumes "RegionOne" rather
than "regionOne" which causes the metadata agent to generate
authentication errors.

Change-Id: I0d3395a215eea7b3e3a9760a81e5f72a6bf523a4
Closes-Bug: #1259344
(cherry picked from commit 534aeb30c7a2c38a2f4294eea62c81e501bc9f2a)

commit_message:
Keystone Verify - Further clarity on the use of ADMIN_PASS

A user reported an issue that the documentation was not clear as to where
the "ADMIN_PASS" paramater came from. I've clarified this further and
added a link to the relevant step to enforce it's origin. Also corrected
a very minor typo.

Note that this is now aware of the way that Debian-based platforms configure
the users in Keystone and links to the relevant page for further assistance.

Change-Id: Ie1722812386591fa0563b57a4127b0042da1ee40
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1252281

commit_message:
Speed up FlowDetail.find

Looking up task by its uuid is quite frequent operation, so it worth
having it executed faster. For that, this commit changes how task
details are stored: we now use uuid -> task detail dictionary instead of
list.

Change-Id: Ie098bf982b5fbca799e0f0f1e736eebff06f9671

commit_message:
Fix errors for create_endpoint api in version2

1. Create an endpoint without 'service_id' should return a 400 Bad Request
with appropriate message instead of 500 Internal Server Error.
2. Empty urls should be discarded.

Change-Id: I535467ec35fe2ae738ecae0a4f20d19ff4f001ec
Closes-Bug: #1250765

commit_message:
Libvirt: Making the video driver element configurable

hw_video_model can be provided via the image properties in Glance.
It may be set to one of the following values: "vga", "cirrus", "vmvga", "xen" or "qxl",
as these are currently being supported by libvirt.

    glance image-update \
       --property hw_video_model=qxl \
       [image]

DocImpact
Partially implements blueprint libvirt-video-driver-selection
Change-Id: Ie710eb9d8d094865d651373c6f9882f1ac12b49a

commit_message:
Rename instance_type to flavor in baremetal virt driver

Goes through the baremetal virt driver and associated classes and tests
and renames instance_type to flavor. This patch does not handle renaming
instance_type in nova.test.utils or the instance_type_id column in the
instance db model so those parts are left unchanged here.

DocImpact: Renames the 'instance_type_extra_specs' option in the
baremetal group to 'flavor_extra_specs'.

Part of blueprint flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: I4405464aea2b2e2142ed1207fb9c25ed9e863cb0

subject: Remove the api_thread_pool option from libvirt driver
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-04 10:10:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove the api_thread_pool option from nova

This gave us the option to select if calls to libvirtd are done
in a native thread or directly. This was added because the person
who wrote the thread pool code was afraid of regressions for existing
deployments. But now we have enough features in nova that require
that this is always set to True or else users can have issues with
them. To this point the firewall overrode this option to make
sure that its call was always in a native thread no matter the
value of this option was.

The reasons behind this were discussed during this review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/57000/

Closes-Bug: 1254811

Change-Id: Ifad7f1bdf2af69e4fcd6f9a04bf2f7ff5251afd6

commit_message:
Remove the api_thread_pool option from libvirt driver

This gave us the option to select if calls to libvirtd are done
in a native thread or directly. This was added because the person
who wrote the thread pool code was afraid of regressions for existing
deployments. But now we have enough features in nova that require
that this is always set to True or else users can have issues with
them. To this point the firewall overrode this option to make
sure that its call was always in a native thread no matter the
value of this option was.

The reasons behind this were discussed during this review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/57000/

Closes-Bug: #1254811

DocImpact: removes api_thread_pool flag from the libvirt group

Change-Id: Ifad7f1bdf2af69e4fcd6f9a04bf2f7ff5251afd6

commit_message:
Periodic task _heal_instance_info_cache can now use slave db

This periodic task will now use a slave db for all reads if a slave
is configured. For deployments with no slave, behavior remains unchanged.

Change-Id: Iafda7ff7a895b21a75c6d3923269f45bc84c81b0
Partially-implements: blueprint periodic-tasks-to-db-slave

Commit cc70e3a adds a finally block to _get_new_connection to
automatically disable the host if making a connection to libvirt fails.

The set_host_enabled method currently swallows all exceptions which is
good so it doesn't mask the original libvirt failure in
_get_new_connection, but we need to have a test that makes sure that

commit_message:
libvirt: add a test to guard against set_host_enabled raising an error

Commit cc70e3a adds a finally block to _get_new_connection to
automatically disable the host if making a connection to libvirt fails.

The set_host_enabled method currently swallows all exceptions which is
good so it doesn't mask the original libvirt failure in
_get_new_connection, but we need to have a test that makes sure that
isn't unintentionally regressed. This patch adds the test.

Related-Bug: #1257644

Change-Id: I4beec053794edc75ef2d0060a05285f7ed0b99ac

commit_message:
Extends V3 servers api for pci support

All pci passthrough code is merged into nova, but the API does not support.
this patch extends the servers to show PCI information for instance and compute
node. This is a part of PCI APIs, for more information see the  blueprint.

Partially implement blueprint pci-api-support

Change-Id: I99eeeca67983c49433ab0079f490a454d250f5e0

commit_message:
Add a trivial functionaltests/run_tests.sh

I need a simple entry point to running the functional test suite for the
devstack gate job.  This script provides that.  Right now it's quite
trivial and just runs nose.  We'll probably want to update this to testr
later, but it really doesn't matter much right now since there's only a
single test case.

Change-Id: I6cd2ce8d11addf70195e2df2e11161cfd58f04bd

subject: Fix the scope to share a server between tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7139, 'name': 'Zhi Kun Liu', 'username': 'zhikunliu', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 8625, 'name': 'Anju Tiwari', 'username': 'Anju5', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 03:51:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix the scope to share a server between tests

In test_server_actions.py, one server is created in setUpClass() and
the server would be shared between all tests.
If the server status is not 'ACTIVE' before each test, rebuild_server()
deletes it and rebuilds a server again.

The server_id scope which is passed to rebuild_server() is class variable
not instance variable. In addition, the server_id scope which is stored
with the return value of rebuild_server() is instance variable like the
following:

  [[instance]]                         [[class]]
  self.server_id = self.rebuild_server(self.server_id)

If we need to rebuild a server, the server_id, which is passed to rebuild_
server(), cannot be changed due to its scope. As the result, many server
creations happens in each test. Then it causes "Quota exceeded" exception.

This patch fixes the scope of server_id for sharing the same server between
each tests.

Change-Id: I72b4aa73a6c77cce3a8e777d4f78913fb0986f66
Fixes-Bug: #1257641

commit_message:
Fix the scope to share a server between tests

In test_server_actions.py, one server is created in setUpClass()
and the server would be shared between all tests.
If the server status is not 'ACTIVE' before each test, rebuild_
server() deletes it and rebuilds a server again.

The server_id scope which is passed to rebuild_server() is class
variable not instance variable. In addition, the server_id scope
which is stored with the return value of rebuild_server() is
instance variable like the following:

  [[instance]]                         [[class]]
  self.server_id = self.rebuild_server(self.server_id)

If we need to rebuild a server, the server_id, which is passed to
rebuild_server(), cannot be changed due to its scope. As the result,
many server creations happens in each test.
Then it causes "Quota exceeded" exception.

This patch fixes the scope of server_id for sharing the same server
between each tests.

Change-Id: I72b4aa73a6c77cce3a8e777d4f78913fb0986f66
Closes-Bug: #1257641

commit_message:
Changes trove_client.client.HTTPClient to
trove_client.HTTPClient

Reasons:
 - trove shell is not working.
 - troveclient.client is now imported as trove_client
   but while calling the method it has been called
   as trove_client.client

Changes:
- Changes trove_client.client.HTTPClient to
  trove_client.HTTPClient in troveclient/v1/client.py

Change-Id: I12b0a0d9792f69ad04a17c36a8de134f233afc85
Closes-Bug: #1259882

subject: Sync oslo threadgroup.py to fix wait & stop methods
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 7135, 'name': 'Liang Chen', 'email': 'liangchen.linux@gmail.com', 'username': 'Liang'}, {'_account_id': 7225, 'name': 'Serg Melikyan', 'email': 'smelikyan@mirantis.com', 'username': 'smelikyan'}, {'_account_id': 7253, 'name': 'Jason Dunsmore', 'email': 'jasondunsmore@gmail.com', 'username': 'jbd'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-09 17:44:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make wait & stop methods work on all threads

Previously, ThreadGroup.wait and ThreadGroup.stop would iterate over
the self.threads list and call the wait or stop method on each one.
This list could potentially be edited concurrently by the _thread_done
callbacks and remove some items in the list.  As a result, the wait
method would not actually wait for all threads in the thread group.

Change-Id: Ia49d7096180b2942cf49b1f0dacde3c5e933337c
Closes-Bug: #1196525
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-10 16:45:09.000000000', 'files': ['heat/openstack/common/threadgroup.py'], 'message': 'Sync oslo threadgroup.py to fix wait & stop methods

Sync oslo threadgroup.py to 25ff65e955b7ef1091722224f7c71f14fc971354 so
we include the fix for bug #1196525, which resolves a problem where the
wait and stop methods would not actually wait for/stop all threads in
the thread group.

Change-Id: Ia49d7096180b2942cf49b1f0dacde3c5e933337c
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Sync oslo threadgroup.py to fix wait & stop methods

Sync oslo threadgroup.py to 25ff65e955b7ef1091722224f7c71f14fc971354 so
we include the fix for bug #1196525, which resolves a problem where the
wait and stop methods would not actually wait for/stop all threads in
the thread group.

Change-Id: Ia49d7096180b2942cf49b1f0dacde3c5e933337c

subject: Have tox install via setup.py develop
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 17:00:19.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

commit_message:
Add zypper element

This provides some customizations for zypper based distributions (e.g.
openSUSE and SLES). It is heavily inspired by the yum element and sets up
zypper to cache downloaded package outside of the chroot so that they can be
reused to speed up subsequent builds.

Change-Id: I775c921ee19cf7d1180fb68c1b7857ea6245a77d

commit_message:
Separate deployments from tasks

The patch introduce deployments as independent operations. The command
line interface supports of creation, deletion and recreation of
deployments. The creation of the task requires the id of a deployment.

The patch also separate samples of configuration to two types: a
deployment and a task.

Change-Id: I5121532057909040e6ab6d6b2cbd6d06812975cb
Implements: blueprint independent-deploy

commit_message:
Remove start index 0 in range()

Remove the useless arg ("start index" = 0) in files, since its default
value is 0, to make code cleaner.

Fixes bug #1259744

Change-Id: I02fc3d96cacdbae1be9e9283362bb87518d97a7c

commit_message:
Make _extra_keys a property of ModelBase

Currently  _get_extra_keys() used as as function.
Changing it to read only property makes class interface more cleaner
and reliable
We don't have to explicitly call it and it can't be accidently overriden
by assigning of an instance variable

Change-Id: I236408be953f299854fce80aa38e24708c13a60a

commit_message:
Enables db2 server disconnects to be handled pessimistically

A checkout listener can be added to sqlalchemy to be able to
handle database disconnect pessimistically and avoid an error in
the event of a DB restart or simply a temp connection issue due
to network glitches. At the moment only mysql is enabled with
this feature. This patch enables db2 as well.

Partial-Bug: #1231657
Change-Id: I5563360b43c4b648f5b035099b0e1d2e71d32503

subject: Have tox install via setup.py develop
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 16:59:05.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

commit_message:
Increase the size heuristic for images

Occasionally cloud-init fails to resize the disk on first boot, this is
occuring because the filesystem has only 10% free. Nudging the disk size
up a bit more should give us a little more headroom so this is less
likely to occur.

I havn't been able to find out what value ensures we wont hit this
problem but I can say for sure this fixes all casses of the problem I
have seen.

Change-Id: Ib23f3a654151338ad91839e49b323b65b4054245

commit_message:
Fix a race condition in agents status update code

Code handling agents status updates coming via RPC checks,
if a corresponding entry for the given (agent_type, host)
pair already exists in DB and updates it. And if it doesn't
exist, a new entry is created.

Without a unique constraint this can cause a race condition
resulting in adding of two agent entries having the same value
of (agent_type, host) pair.

Note, that it's already not allowed to have multiple agents of
the same type having the same host value, but currently it's
enforced only at code level, not at DB schema level, which
effectively makes race conditions possible.

Closes-Bug: #1254246

Change-Id: I1ebaa111154b3d6b34074705b579097ab730594c

subject: Add a warning to @memoized when caching is impossible
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1941, 'name': 'Lin Hua Cheng', 'email': 'os.lcheng@gmail.com', 'username': 'lin-hua-cheng'}, {'_account_id': 4264, 'name': 'Matthias Runge', 'email': 'mrunge@redhat.com', 'username': 'mrunge'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 6914, 'name': 'Tatiana Ovchinnikova', 'email': 't.v.ovtchinnikova@gmail.com', 'username': 'tmazur'}, {'_account_id': 9275, 'name': 'Leandro Ignacio Costantino', 'email': 'leandro.i.costantino@intel.com', 'username': 'lcostantino'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-04 09:12:00.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/utils/memoized.py'], 'message': "Add a warning to @memoized when caching is impossible

The @memoized decorator cannot cache function calls that take unhashable
arguments. So far it just ignored them, and silently called the function
directly without any cache. This commit adds a warning in such case, so
that we can see where @memoized is not really doing anything.

I used Python's warning mechanism, because we can easily configure the
particular warning to become an exception or to be ignored entirely.

Change-Id: I4b581f504972ffac589fdb78bfb9fb194d2b4525
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add a warning to @memoized when caching is impossible

The @memoized decorator cannot cache function calls that take unhashable
arguments. So far it just ignored them, and silently called the function
directly without any cache. This commit adds a warning in such case, so
that we can see where @memoized is not really doing anything.

I used Python's warning mechanism, because we can easily configure the
particular warning to become an exception or to be ignored entirely.

Change-Id: I4b581f504972ffac589fdb78bfb9fb194d2b4525

commit_message:
Hide injected_file related quotas for V3 API

The injected_files, injected_file_content_bytes and
injected_file_path_bytes are all related to the
os-personalities extension which has been removed. They
can't be removed from the core quotas code as that has
to still support the V2 API. So for the V3 API we just
hide them.

DocImpact

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-remove-extensions

Change-Id: Iedb6e1427ac22f1926e929f3391e56403c37d088

commit_message:
Fix docstring on novaclient

Something like this:

1. Modify "`Image` to add metadata to" to ""`Image` to delete metadata" on
delete_meta()
2. Modify "The security group to delete" to "The security group to update"
on update()
3. Remove the "password" from the description on update()

Change-Id: I0120d84cc263d4eb58b692a5eb6f20ca0ef8264d
Closes-Bug: #1258461

commit_message:
Add -U to pip install command in tox.ini

Ask pip to upgrade packages in the virtualenv so that a long-lived
virtualenv is still kept up to date as external dependencies change.

Change-Id: Ife76a83be95fed7cc4b99bb50a97277d0751e76c

commit_message:
Add configuration-driven conversion to Events

Add configuration to control what traits get added to Events
from notifications, how those traits are defined, and what
notifications get converted (and eventually stored).

Change-Id: I2befc97b3d3b33851a5bfe709bf086895fd72cce
Implements: blueprint configurable-event-definitions

commit_message:
Fix display_name of volume for test_volumes_list

In test_volumes_list, three volumes are created for some tests.
These display_name seems wrong like "volume-%s1393726625json".
The interface name should be inserted after "volume-", but it is
appended to the tail.
This patch fixes this volume name.

Change-Id: Iee55d2405e888569455a2325fe6b2843ddf9de9d

subject: Have tox install via setup.py develop
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 16:46:09.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

commit_message:
ignore failures to apt-get update calls

systems may have a ton of apt repos on them, many of which aren't
really needed. We'd rather take the updates we can, and not fail
on secondary repositories, especially as secondary repository fails
will stop us dead in our tracks.

Closes-Bug: #1259911

Change-Id: I08b19cd4d48fba3b4884fa4bc011cde451136594

commit_message:
Store/restore Server from a dict with credentials

The patch adds two methods to Server class to get a dict with
credentials from instance of its class and restore an instance from
credentials. LxcProvider requires reconstruction of the Server
objects for destruction of resources.

blueprint db-resource-track

Change-Id: I2f9ca4a1c49477d665ba02ff0736c21a7557e12a

    In Firefox $('body').scrollTop returns 0, that's why the modal
    appear outside the visible screen. Added $('hmtl).scrollTop.

    var scrollShift = $('body').scrollTop() || $('html').scrollTop()

    Closes-Bug: 1251361

    Change-Id: Icf691eb140e091615a98f1fbd415428cd418ba9e

Change-Id: Icd36a50c96943e534379d77d83a37465a84ce451
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Change how scrollShift is calculated.

    In Firefox $('body').scrollTop returns 0, that's why the modal
    appear outside the visible screen. Added $('hmtl).scrollTop.

    var scrollShift = $('body').scrollTop() || $('html').scrollTop()

    Closes-Bug: 1251361

    Change-Id: Icf691eb140e091615a98f1fbd415428cd418ba9e

Change-Id: Icd36a50c96943e534379d77d83a37465a84ce451

commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: Ic3920c893630d10780f4e6b42451f6b2c1837a66
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <paul.belanger@polybeacon.com>

subject: Deprecate chance and simple schedulers
revisions:

With the addition of ChanceWeigher, the policies of both the chance
and simple schedulers can now be implemented using the filter
scheduler. Keeping these schedulers unnecessarily increases the test
matrix and significantly increases the development effort of new
features that require scheduler support. Not to mention that they were

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-12-10 07:26:26.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/scheduler/simple.py', 'cinder/tests/integrated/integrated_helpers.py', 'cinder/scheduler/chance.py'], 'message': 'Deprecate chance and simple schedulers

With the addition of ChanceWeigher, the policies of both the chance
and simple schedulers can now be implemented using the filter
scheduler. Keeping these schedulers unnecessarily increases the test

1. Integrated unit tests will now use the default scheduler.

Change-Id: If75ad20765fa57fc8951edc8ca4b1436f313cfed

commit_message:
Deprecate chance and simple schedulers

With the addition of ChanceWeigher, the policies of both the chance
and simple schedulers can now be implemented using the filter
scheduler. Keeping these schedulers unnecessarily increases the test
matrix and significantly increases the development effort of new
features that require scheduler support.

1. Integrated unit tests will now use the default scheduler.
2. For now, print a warning if either of these schedulers is used.
3. New features that require scheduler functions need not add support
   for simple and chance. Any bugs found should still be fixed.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint deprecate-chance-and-simple-schedulers

Change-Id: If75ad20765fa57fc8951edc8ca4b1436f313cfed

of testset and test entities against db has been wrapped in try...except

commit_message:
Tests refactoring for ci

Function setUpPackage() from tests/__init__.py was modified: ostf-server
setup was added as child process via subprocess.Process() construction
so that now both unit and functional tests can be run without any pre
setup of fake ostf-server nor nailgunmimic because these actions are
managed now by nose.

Change-Id: Icc6972d1aa413321a89c924cda3b9cc9ae9cb4ee

commit_message:
secrets.get should verify that the request is for a single secret

Added sanity checking to the requested URI path to make sure it is a
properly formed secret UUID value.

Change-Id: Ie6598303e502cd19458e0beef24d7fd032f9f14a
Closes-Bug: #1259654

commit_message:
Add processing for additional tests status 'skipped'

In models for enum attribute of Test entity new value has been added.
addError hook method of StoragePlugin has been modified with purpose to
process new result state of executed tests which now can be 'skipped'.
Unit and functional tests were updated.

Change-Id: I593d67eed12a9a20ba795501a1f8cceedfbb4587
Implements: blueprint additional-tests-statuses
