commit_message:
opensuse: Update README.md

Remove the comment about the rpm-distro element. The only tiny bit we copied
from it is 01-install-bin. 01-override-zypp-arch was unneeded and has been
removed from the opensuse element before the initial merge.

Change-Id: I9886bb6e7d723690f2d2ac476d6d3aca5a367607

commit_message:
Sync oslo log for "Adding domain to context and log"

Syncing the log from oslo-incubator change Ic2cf3e52 "Adding domain to
context and log" without dependencies.

Note: I did not sync context.py since it's obsolete and not used in Nova.

Changes in the module log:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header
Change Ie2886da6: Don't log to stdout when log_dir is set
Change I97971f2a: Unify different names between Python2/3 with six.moves

Change-Id: Ib11e015666701868410d743dad4218d92376d181
Related-Bug: #1248936

commit_message:
Adding information about domain in the context

Adding the variables domain_id, project_domain_id and user_domain_id to
the RequestContext in order to be able to implement domain quotas. If no
domain information is in the header the variables are set to 'default',
since it's the default value for domain in Keystone V2.0 API.

Change-Id: Ice7805041d2df72d603e9d56a5df4cf7f5489992
Closes-bug: #1248936

commit_message:
Added method exec_longrun_command.

Unlike exec_command and exec_command_on_vm, this method allows
to start a process on VM in background and leave it alive
after it closes the SSH session.

Change-Id: If7a831330249035f22ad1abb9a2aa780ab1cf4fe

commit_message:
Non major core refactoring

Some utilities were grouped in new file mixins.py. This was done with
purpose of code spreading minimazing. Because of that two files are not
neede any more so they were deleted (utils/utils.py and wsgi_utils.py).
Unit and functional tests were updated.

Change-Id: Ia0752eaf145ca38b17a4d3f30b9c0e72566a1288

commit_message:
Port StringType class from WSME trunk

Port the StringType class and its tests from WSME trunk. The StringType
is needed for the implementation of our PatchType class that will make
use of the complex type validation of WSME to remove some of the custom
validation code.

See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60194/

Change-Id: If387ed915e4d0102112f93ed16eee13775b54f4c

commit_message:
Hide AZ when creating Volume from snapshot

Volume created from snapshot must match the AZ of the snapshot.
It doesn't make sense to allow the user to select the AZ as the
only valid values are Any AZ or AZ of the snapshot - which the user
still need to figure out.

Change-Id: Id3fb03fc2bc152ae0af72b939f63d9d403324fe6
Closes-Bug: #1257845

commit_message:
Add a loadAngular function

    If something is added to the DOM with external tools, angular is not
aware of these changes (Ajax call, pure js DOM manipulation, etc...).
This patch add an utility function which will load angular on the given
element.
    There is also an example on modal, angular is now loaded when a
modal is shown.

Fixes bug #1258192

Change-Id: I3266b455d79d7d1856e4a622e927ed4af8e90b5e

commit_message:
Remove glusterfs_disk_util option

The glusterfs_disk_util option has been removed. I have manually
removed this entry from the current configuration tables and the
flag mapping.

As it is no longer in the code it will also no longer appear in
future auto-generated versions of the tables.

Closes-Bug: #1259419

Change-Id: I4aa606b3920347caa896c5b65ddcff6d9faf9881

commit_message:
Fix database configuration in heat.conf for YUM

Follow-up to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61402
The Heat installation notes refer to the database configuration as done
in master, but it doesn't work completely with the new format in Havana.
Let's keep the old format for now.

Change-Id: I8f47206b0ae4856c67139c0b3634bb7880c37cc9
Closes-Bug: #1257436
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Tests refactoring for ci

Function setUpPackage() from tests/__init__.py was modified: ostf-server
setup was added as child process via subprocess.Process() construction
so that now both unit and functional tests can be run without any pre
setup of fake ostf-server nor nailgunmimic because these actions are
managed now by nose.

Change-Id: I74a99053273af7c8257cc8775d05d05e3387e9b2

commit_message:
Add some logging for nose_discovery process

Methods of DiscoveryPlugin were modified: logic that controls processing
of testset and test entities against db has been wrapped in try...except
block with purpose to provide logging for possible errors which may
occur during this process.

Change-Id: Idac9883e8bff5034fcd4970fed98e831b538147b

subject: don't have grenade hit the network with apt, as the network breaks
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 12:26:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "don't have grenade hit the network with apt, as the network breaks

... a lot

grenade is currently triggering an apt-get update before it installs
packages, which isn't appropriate in the node pool nodes. It also
ends up breaking a ton when rax nodes decide to not be able to get
access to apt.puppetlabs.com.

This will short circuit that logic.

Change-Id: I357be8ab500aa734d399e71e49739fc113e93211
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-11 12:58:33.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "don't have grenade hit the network with apt, as the network breaks

... a lot

grenade is currently triggering an apt-get update before it installs
packages, which isn't appropriate in the node pool nodes. It also
ends up breaking a ton when rax nodes decide to not be able to get
access to apt.puppetlabs.com.

This will short circuit that logic.

Closes-Bug: #1259911

Change-Id: I357be8ab500aa734d399e71e49739fc113e93211
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
don't have grenade hit the network with apt, as the network breaks

... a lot

grenade is currently triggering an apt-get update before it installs
packages, which isn't appropriate in the node pool nodes. It also
ends up breaking a ton when rax nodes decide to not be able to get
access to apt.puppetlabs.com.

This will short circuit that logic.

Closes-Bug: #1259911

Change-Id: I357be8ab500aa734d399e71e49739fc113e93211

commit_message:
Fix database configuration in heat.conf

The Heat installation notes refer to the database configuration as done
in master, but it doesn't work completely with the new format in Havana.
Let's keep the old format for now.

JavaScript use policy

contributing.

Add information about JavaScript support policy to the contributing
docs.

The policy is based on:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-November/020342.html

commit_message:
change sphinx requirement to < 1.1.99 because 1.2b3 exists

< 1.2 seems right, except 1.2b3 is also < 1.2 by python version
rules. In the gate, with the mirror, this seems to work. However
on local envirnments 1.2b3 is often pulled, and local doc builds
break.

Backported From: I719536a0754bb532b800c52082aeb4e2033e174f

Change-Id: I453ea0f16d5cf6274511676f789e7667b0a8984c

commit_message:
Set auth_uri for keystoneclient authtoken

Updates are authtoken middleware settings so we configure auth_uri.
This resolves several log WARNINGs that appear when the config
isn't set.

Ideally keystoneclient would set auth_uri automatically.
A known issue...  see keystone bug #1207517

Change-Id: I0b8ce0a52d1c094c18aae85f76acf5fc33b814b7

subject: Remove asserts for optional imports
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-15 09:10:19.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/__init__.py'], 'message': "Remove asserts for optional imports

Horizon's __init__.py has some code that explicitly allows it to
be imported by setup.py before Django is set up, by making import
failures just throw a warning instead of an exception. But that code
is defeated by a bunch of asserts that were added later, that just
make the error even more confusing.

I'm removing the asserts and replacing them with __all__.

Closes-bug: #1210253
Change-Id: I0fde7810a033fd7216da9a5460f5e4e323b4d6e9
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove asserts for optional imports

Horizon's __init__.py has some code that explicitly allows it to
be imported by setup.py before Django is set up, by making import
failures just throw a warning instead of an exception. But that code
is defeated by a bunch of asserts that were added later, that just
make the error even more confusing.

I'm removing the asserts and replacing them with __all__.

Closes-bug: #1210253
Change-Id: I0fde7810a033fd7216da9a5460f5e4e323b4d6e9

commit_message:
Adds cinder.keymgr.fixed_key to cinder element

Not having keymgr.fixed_key causes tons of WARNING messages like:

 WARNING cinder.keymgr.conf_key_mgr [-] config option keymgr.fixed_key
 has not been defined: some operations may fail unexpectedly

Once this lands we can add a bit of overcloud metadata so we set
a reasonable default for this (perhaps 'unset' even)...

Change-Id: I8cf41379aae0e0ed460c4b27f7279796c8ad8f8d

[{'created': '2013-10-01 08:17:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Configurable cell_class in DataTable.

There are two changes in this proposal. One is to move the logic
for extracting cell data from the row datum (and handling auto columns)
to the Cell class, into a separate method for easy extending. The
second is to make that extending possible by making the cell class
configurable in the DataTable's meta.

Those changes are supposed to make it easier to extend the DataTable
with new kinds of cells -- for example, cells that contain an editable
widget, a progress bar, an icon, etc. as well as make it easier to

changes would also make it easier to integrate DataTable with a Django
FormSet.

Right now, in order to modify any of the proposed Cell.get_data
behavior, one has to make their own Row class and practically copy-paste
the whole Row.load_cells method, as there is no easy way to extend it.

Change-Id: I29277a9e77e1c413193fe80d3f8cfe001bf5d709

commit_message:
Configurable cell_class in DataTable

There are two changes in this proposal. One is to move the logic
for extracting cell data from the row datum (and handling auto columns)
to the Cell class, into a separate method for easy extending. The
second is to make that extending possible by making the cell class
configurable in the DataTable's meta.

Those changes are supposed to make it easier to extend the DataTable
with new kinds of cells -- for example, cells that contain an editable
widget, a progress bar, an icon, etc. as well as make it easier to
modify the behavior of the auto columns -- for example, by making it
possible to have some of the multi_select checkboxes preselected. Those
changes would also make it easier to integrate DataTable with a Django
FormSet.

Right now, in order to modify any of the proposed Cell.get_data
behavior, one has to make their own Row class and practically copy-paste
the whole Row.load_cells method, as there is no easy way to extend it.

Change-Id: I29277a9e77e1c413193fe80d3f8cfe001bf5d709
Closes-Bug: #1229677

commit_message:
Run selenium tests only when requested

In some environments, it's not wanted or possible
to execute selenium tests. These are only executed, if
--with-selenium is specified.

Change-Id: I39c40ac1feb64565f0bcbc97f6345d203b1d816e
Closes-Bug: 1259072

commit_message:
Adds Trove mock to tests in database_backups

Test cases in database_backups/tests.py now have a mock for the
method api.trove.instance_get(). The absence of this mock was
causing real HTTP requests to Trove.

Change-Id: Icf760d7eaba2d136626dbbbbf6e49260a18fb874
Closes-Bug: #1255936

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-21 15:29:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow translators to control word order of BatchAction message

Currently BatchAction message is generated by concatenating
'action' and 'data_type'. In most cases 'action' is a verb
and 'data_type' is an object. However in some action such as
TerminateInstance 'action' is a combination of verb and
object (e.g., "Scheduled termination of").  It is hard that
translators find translated strings which covers both cases.

This commit allows classes inheriting BatchAction to specify
a full action name containing '%(data_type)s' substitution
in action_present/ action_past so that translators can
control the order of phrases completely.

* _conjugate() in actions.py is renamed to _get_action_name()
  because this method no longer always conjugate words.
* Changes action_past strings which are not a form of verb + obj
  to strings with "%(data_type)s"

Closes-Bug: #1253678
Change-Id: I3cf1dc74e22745eb3a9bd2edc3ec68ed389495b5
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-10 14:24:29.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/database_backups/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images_and_snapshots/volume_snapshots/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/tables.py', 'horizon/tables/actions.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/vpn/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/loadbalancers/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/volumes/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/databases/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/tables.py'], 'message': 'Allow translators to control word order of BatchAction message

This commit allows classes inheriting BatchAction to specify

commit_message:
Allow translators to control word order of BatchAction message

Currently BatchAction message is generated by concatenating
'action' and 'data_type'. In most cases 'action' is a verb
and 'data_type' is an object. However in some action such as
TerminateInstance 'action' is a combination of verb and
object (e.g., "Scheduled termination of").  It is hard that
translators find translated strings which covers both cases.

This commit allows classes inheriting BatchAction to specify
a full action name containing '%(data_type)s' substitution
in action_present/ action_past so that translators can
control the order of phrases completely.

* _conjugate() in actions.py is renamed to _get_action_name()
  because this method no longer always conjugate words.
* Changes action_past strings which are not a form of verb + obj
  to strings with "%(data_type)s"

Closes-Bug: #1253678
Change-Id: I3cf1dc74e22745eb3a9bd2edc3ec68ed389495b5

commit_message:
Incubation / Graduation / New program requirements

The TC applies a number of criteria when considering project incubation
and graduation to integrated status, and when considering new programs.
These reference documents should track the minimal requirements that we
apply, so that candidate projects and teams know what is expected of
them.

These documents, by nature, do not contain all the criteria that each
member of the TC will apply when evaluating applications. They are
just the ever-evolving minimal set of requirements that are consensual
amongst TC members.

NB: Some currently-incubated, currently-integrated or currently-official
projects and programs do not fill all of those requirements, as some of
them are new requirements we recently imposed to raise the quality of
the end-result, based on past experience. Those teams and projects
should try to cover the gap during the Icehouse cycle.

Change-Id: Ieedc64a20135e3498786bee6fc54d91b9cf2a93a

commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which
is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line.
In this case, it's important as it allows us to
stop getting pre-release software we were not
asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: Iddf85d33b57f256d72756b516c23492e9600bedc

commit_message:
Handle rest client 500 response if non-json body

* Rest client should gracefully handle 500 response from api
  with non-json body.
* Use response body as is in case of above issue.

Closes-Bug: #950449

commit_message:
Implement stack-locking for multi-engine support

Implements a distributed stack lock using the database to avoid race
conditions when multiple engines are deployed.

Blueprint multiple-engines

Change-Id: If3c47dafcc5bc1b2188b7737205291bbab8bc231

subject: Remove outdated libvirt_vif_driver settings
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 00:39:38.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-single-flat.xml', 'doc/training-guide/training-labs/Scripts/Nova/Templates/SingleNode/nova/nova.conf', 'doc/install-guide/section_neutron-per-tenant-routers-with-private-networks.xml', 'doc/config-reference/networking/section_networking-config-identity.xml'], 'message': "Remove outdated libvirt_vif_driver settings

There is no longer a need to modify the libvirt_vif_driver conf
setting, it should always be the default value of:

libvirt_vif_driver=nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LibvirtGenericVIFDriver

This patch removes any reference to deprecated options for the
libvirt_vif_driver parameter.

Closes-bug #1192833

As a side-effect, this patch removes a section that contains this note:

      <note>
        <para>When using libvirt < 0.9.11, one must also edit
            <filename>/etc/libvirt/qemu.conf</filename>, uncomment the
          entry for 'cgroup_device_acl', add the value '/dev/net/tun'
          to the list of items for the configuration entry, and then
          restart libvirtd.</para>
      </note>

It's not clear to me whether this is required or not with the
generic VIF driver plugin.

Change-Id: I233b18c8021bae6218faee63828c093d9b5b883d
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit a31f8101cbf103916cc0b293a66ccb9bf96d46e1)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove outdated libvirt_vif_driver settings

There is no longer a need to modify the libvirt_vif_driver conf
setting, it should always be the default value of:

libvirt_vif_driver=nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LibvirtGenericVIFDriver

This patch removes any reference to deprecated options for the
libvirt_vif_driver parameter.

Closes-bug #1192833

As a side-effect, this patch removes a section that contains this note:

      <note>
        <para>When using libvirt < 0.9.11, one must also edit
            <filename>/etc/libvirt/qemu.conf</filename>, uncomment the
          entry for 'cgroup_device_acl', add the value '/dev/net/tun'
          to the list of items for the configuration entry, and then
          restart libvirtd.</para>
      </note>

It's not clear to me whether this is required or not with the
generic VIF driver plugin.

Change-Id: I233b18c8021bae6218faee63828c093d9b5b883d
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit a31f8101cbf103916cc0b293a66ccb9bf96d46e1)

commit_message:
Sync global requirements to pin sphinx to sphinx>=1.1.2,<1.2

Sync the global requirements to pin sphinx. This addresses an issue
where Sphinx 1.2 is not building documents correctly and causing
check/gate to fail.

This is the initial commit of the savanna puppet module.

Installs the OpenStack savanna UI and backend. Example of
use can be seen in example/example.pp

Implements: blueprint puppet-savanna

commit_message:
Fix -a opt to boot-seed-vm.

Fixes an issue in 444c63128d0354c97d66a3bb5b8e23ea39633bbb where

an argument as well...

commit_message:
ML2 plugin basic configuration

This is initial documentation for basic configuration of ML2 plugin.
ML2 configuration and use cases documented by Sukhdev and closed by patchset for Bug #1230276
So this document patchset relates both to Bug #1230266 and #1230276

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-11-06 13:06:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'safe_delete_from_backend does not raise exceptions

The safe_delete_from_backend in glance/store/__init__.py does not raise
the appropriate exceptions. For eg) In situations where delete of non existent image is attempted,
it simply sends off a warning without raising the Not Found Exception. As a result the end response
received for the request is deceiving. Looks like the safe_delete is
being called from the controller delete as well as from an
upload_data_to_store during a mismatch. Ideally upload errors should
catch the exceptions and safely delete where as controller delete should
raise back the caught exception as well

Fixes bug #1245775

commit_message:
Controller delete should raise exceptions

The safe_delete_from_backend in glance/store/__init__.py does not raise
the appropriate exceptions. For eg) In situations where delete of non
existent image is attempted,
it simply sends off a warning without raising the Not Found Exception.
As a result the end response
received for the request is deceiving. Main points to note:

1) safe_delete is being called from the controller delete as well as
from an upload_data_to_store during a mismatch.
2) Upload errors should catch the exceptions and safely delete
3) The controller delete should raise back the caught exception

Fixes bug #1245775
Change-Id: I10cb04a135cc9611f7144192e790693f81788d5b

commit_message:
Closes-Bug: #1252314 Support for Windows in Virtualbox scripts

Added support for Cygwin.\n Increased default disk and memory sizes.\n per QA request: Default NIC number increased to 5 per slave VM.\n Added checks for non-installed Cygwin components\n Default NIC type changed to faster AMD PCnet FAST III.

subject: Remove lock_dir on script failures
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-15 17:47:54.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift-recon-cron'], 'message': 'Remove lock_dir on script failures

Under certain circunstances, if get_async_count or dump_cron_cache calls
fail, the lock_dir is not remved. All subsequent executions of
swift-recon-cron will fail with [Errno 17] file exists and will also die
until the lock_dir is manually removed.

- Move create/remove lock code into methods
- Wrap the get_async_count/dump_cron_cache calls wit bettwe exception
handling to ensure the lock_dir is always removed

Change-Id: I7bfe4c7871aa5fbc77078344dffe0e2a0bb2fc2e
Closes-Bug: #1251713
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove lock_dir on script failures

Under certain circunstances, if get_async_count or dump_cron_cache calls
fail, the lock_dir is not remved. All subsequent executions of
swift-recon-cron will fail with [Errno 17] file exists and will also die
until the lock_dir is manually removed.

- Move create/remove lock code into methods
- Wrap the get_async_count/dump_cron_cache calls wit bettwe exception
handling to ensure the lock_dir is always removed

Change-Id: I7bfe4c7871aa5fbc77078344dffe0e2a0bb2fc2e
Closes-Bug: #1251713

commit_message:
Allow time for keystone restart after db_sync

Allow time for keystone service to restart after a keystone-manage
db_sync run to ensure that subsequent keystone queries do not get
connection refused errors.

commit_message:
Allow short names for volume_driver in cinder.conf

This allows configuring the volume driver like:
volume_driver="nfs"
instead of
volume_driver="cinder.volume.drivers.nfs.NfsDriver"

The setting is also treated as case-insensitive to allow "LVM" or
"lvm", etc.

Driver identifiers not listed in the translation table will be
treated as class paths, as before.

Change-Id: I9e28e2afb07c88353a546a87e76a3220b051c9f2

subject: Stale kvm processes when using libguestfs
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-03 22:14:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/disk/vfs/guestfs.py', 'nova/virt/disk/api.py'], 'message': 'Stale kvm processes when using libguestfs

When setting up images for nova there is insufficient error handling
when using libguestfs which leaves stale kvm processes on the compute
node.  These stale processes consume CPU and memory and can starve a
compute node of resources.  The stale processes are not reaped when the
instance that triggered the libguestfs injection is deleted.

Change-Id: I96ed4fc6871af0134c69fc3b2d39a750a5e5d0f2
Partial-Bug: #1246852
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Stale kvm processes when using libguestfs

When setting up images for nova there is insufficient error handling
when using libguestfs which leaves stale kvm processes on the compute
node.  These stale processes consume CPU and memory and can starve a
compute node of resources.  The stale processes are not reaped when the
instance that triggered the libguestfs injection is deleted.

Change-Id: I96ed4fc6871af0134c69fc3b2d39a750a5e5d0f2
Partial-Bug: #1246852

commit_message:
Sync Log Levels from OSLO

The iso8601 debug messages were spamming neutron-server's logs.

cbfded9c Default iso8601 logging to WARN

Change-Id: I526813fd4b29e23977c459c70ac63d87bd33b849
Closes-Bug: 1257396

commit_message:
OpenStack Identity API v3 OS-SHARED-SECRET Extension

Provide the ability for identity users to request a token using a shared
secret authorization method. This extension requires v3.0+ of the
Identity API.
The user provides a credential_id to identify the credential type and the
corresponding shared-secret information as secret.

blueprint access-key-authentication

Change-Id: Ibfbef444395e9eaa773a56839f38fa1697ebac64

commit_message:
Adding extra specs to flavor show and detail call

Adding a new extension in v3 which will add 'extra_specs'
to the flavor show and detail call. This will include the
extra_specs, along with the other information
related to the flavor.

Implements blueprint add-extra-specs-to-flavor-list

Change-Id: I432846ebbb0b7a0f06dc48abf9337084d75f1d3f

subject: Clean-up files use
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-09 10:59:15.000000000', 'files': ['files/connection.py', 'files/compute.py', 'files/nova-novncproxy.init', 'manifests/compute/file_hack.pp'], 'message': 'Clean-up files use

- file_hack was a hack used in Essex and now outdated.
- nothing is using nova-novncproxy.init

This patch aims to delete files/* and file_hack.pp which is now
useless.

Change-Id: I94b40e34fd61d778c7450d149f49e28612c58d31
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Clean-up files use

- file_hack was a hack used in Essex and now outdated.
- nothing is using nova-novncproxy.init

This patch aims to delete files/* and file_hack.pp which is now
useless.

Change-Id: I94b40e34fd61d778c7450d149f49e28612c58d31
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Add metering agent support

The Ceilometer project is able to get meters from Neutron via the
notifications system on how much bandwidth the projects are using.
The idea is to meter this as the L3 routers levels.

The feature exists since Havana.

Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
implement blueprint metering-agent

Change-Id: I62ad9b7455e5f2bc3455b55a346f2515ca1040a3
(cherry picked from commit bf34f8631cfae0550dbe082740668df82f0cdfd4)

[{'created': '2013-12-04 16:59:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'TTL mechanism support with expirer service

commit_message:
TTL mechanism support with expirer service

Aims to support a TTL mechanism for data entering Ceilometer
collector database.
TTL is very useful to configure when getting a lot of meters.

implement blueprint ttl-support
Change-Id: I9d98e8b833ad94fd79722dee7226e7f4f03aaa2e
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Sync minor updates in oslo.db module

* vim headers removed
* py3kcompat/urlutils functions used instead of urlparse
* log.warning() used instead of log.warn()
* license, typos and docstrings fixed
* locking fixed

Change-Id: I2a9bfc04ae473220da39cdf723247deba87dc07b

Add py3kcompat utils module

It's needed for the updated oslo.db code.
Currently it only provides urlutils.

commit_message:
add more test cases to improve the test code coverage #5

In this patch, the following module test coverage improved to 100%

ceilometer/alarm/partition/coordination

Class PartitionIdentity was not tested for various method. This
patch set correct that problem. Also, class PartitionCoordinator
has 3 exception branches were not tested. This patch set added
more test cases to check these conditions.

Change-Id: Ia33a28e1650b6312843375af04973c9d5da2d89d

commit_message:
db.sqlalchemy.session add [sql].idle_timeout

Keystone is using idle_timeout in the [sql] section for the
idle timeout. Before Keystone can use oslo-incubator's
db.sqlalchemy.session we'll need to be able to have the old
option still be usable but deprecated.

bp use-common-oslo-db-code

Change-Id: Ic3dd4ec7f678f9564597830f9e4764d979a5d18a

commit_message:
Explicitly define "auth_region" in Neutron metadata_agent.ini

The default value for "auth_region" assumes "RegionOne" rather
than "regionOne" which causes the metadata agent to generate
authentication errors.

Change-Id: I0d3395a215eea7b3e3a9760a81e5f72a6bf523a4
Closes-Bug: #1259344

subject: Properly handle Regions in keystoneclient
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 357, 'name': 'Devin Carlen', 'email': 'devin@openstack.org', 'username': 'devcamcar'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6223, 'name': 'Cody A.W. Somerville', 'email': 'cody.somerville@gmail.com', 'username': 'cody-somerville'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 6917, 'name': 'Bartosz Górski', 'email': 'bartosz@codilime.com', 'username': 'bartosz-gorski'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-01 07:08:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Properly handle Regions in keystoneclient

Region name is taken as a parameter but is ignored in all communication
with the service catalog. Region is something that belongs in most url
selection functions so add them there and add deprecation comments to a
number of places where the old functionality is incorrect.

Whilst there clean up a lot of the service catalog functions to provide
some more common functionality. This reveals some targets for cleanup
later but at the moment all the old behaviour is maintained.

Fixes bug 1147530

Change-Id: I812aa89c8b4af28e294e63926a7f88e8246fffc5
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-02 00:31:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Properly handle Regions in keystoneclient

Region name is taken as a parameter but is ignored in all communication
with the service catalog. Currently region can be stored in the token
data and then requests to url functions will return the appropriate
region. This is the wrong approach because there is nothing specifiy to
the token (or auth_data) that is region specific. Instead region
information should be held by the client.

Add the ability to query region to url functions. Also do some cleanup
to provide common functions between the v2 and v3 service catalog.

Fixes bug 1147530

Change-Id: I812aa89c8b4af28e294e63926a7f88e8246fffc5
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-10-02 23:45:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Properly handle Regions in keystoneclient

data and then requests to url functions will return the appropriate

the token (or auth_data) that is region specific. Instead region
information should be held by the client.

Add the ability to query region to url functions. Also do some cleanup
to provide common functions between the v2 and v3 service catalog.

Fixes bug 1147530

Change-Id: I812aa89c8b4af28e294e63926a7f88e8246fffc5

commit_message:
Properly handle Regions in keystoneclient

Region name is taken as a parameter but is ignored in all communication
with the service catalog. Currently region can be stored in the token
data and then requests to url functions will return the appropriate
region. This is the wrong approach because there is nothing specific to
the token (or auth_data) that is region specific. Instead region
information should be held by the client.

Closes-Bug: 1147530
Closes-Bug: 1255992
Change-Id: I812aa89c8b4af28e294e63926a7f88e8246fffc5

commit_message:
Add load balancer PoolMember resource

This adds a new resource to manage the relationship between a load
balancing pool and an address, allowing more options like setting the
weight of the member.

Change-Id: Ic8a55ff8b8b00c7a4e3184b3028d5bf0cdd5c916
Implements: blueprint loadbalancer-pool-members

for details.

commit_message:
Add OS::Neutron::NetDHCPAgent for neutron/net.py

This resource supports part of "agent management and scheduler
extensions" in Neutron.  It associates network with dhcp-agent.

I think, it may be needed by administrators who want to decide agents to
work. (e.g. to use HA functionality)

Closes-bug: #1245366
Change-Id: I3dc663c4c51824bd3e69c74ff1d9b50a8ce598c9

commit_message:
Sync global requirements to pin sphinx to sphinx>=1.1.2,<1.2

Sync the global requirements to pin sphinx.  This addresses an issue
where Sphinx 1.2 is not building documents correctly and causing
check/gate to fail.

We also had to adjust the pip command used.

commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb

commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: Ic3920c893630d10780f4e6b42451f6b2c1837a66
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <paul.belanger@polybeacon.com>
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <paul.belanger@polybeacon.com>

commit_message:
Add config options for enabled extensions

This commit adds a new set of config options to the feature_enabled
groups for a list of enabled extensions. These options are used to
specify whether all extensions are enabled or which subset is expected
to be enabled. This just sets up the initial framework for doing
this and converts the FlavorExtraSpecs tests to use it.

paritally implements bp config-cleanup

Change-Id: I6a5a9b16e62eb8a216334a0662c99f0dd0d16873

commit_message:
Add a REST API to disable/enable a flavor.

If a flavor is disabled, it is invisible to tenants while show a list of flavors.
But if a flavor is already associated with instances, a tenants can still access it by the flavor_id.

usage: nova flavor-disabled <flavor> <disabled>

Sample request:
REQ: curl -i 770bbdfdd5c2472383641bb33b77725a/flavors/12">http://127.0.0.1:8774/v2/770bbdfdd5c2472383641bb33b77725a/flavors/12
                 -d '{"flavor": {"OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled": true}}

Sample output from CLI:

cloud@devstack:~$ nova help flavor-disabled
usage: nova flavor-disabled <flavor_id> <disabled>

Change the visibility of a flavor between Enabled and Disabled.

Positional arguments:
  <flavor_id>  flavor id.
  <disabled>   value of disabled (true or false).

cloud@devstack:~$ nova flavor-disabled 12 true
+--------------------------+-------+
| Property                 | Value |
+--------------------------+-------+
| OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled | True  |
| disk                     | 0     |
| extra_specs              | {}    |
| id                       | 12    |
| name                     | test  |
| ram                      | 1024  |
| vcpus                    | 1     |
+--------------------------+-------+

cloud@devstack:~$ nova flavor-list
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+
| ID | Name      | Memory_MB | Disk | Ephemeral | Swap | VCPUs | RXTX_Factor | Is_Public | Disabled |
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+
| 1  | m1.tiny   | 512       | 1    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 12 | test      | 1024      | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | True     |
| 13 | test1     | 1024      | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 2  | m1.small  | 2048      | 20   | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 3  | m1.medium | 4096      | 40   | 0         |      | 2     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 4  | m1.large  | 8192      | 80   | 0         |      | 4     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 42 | m1.nano   | 64        | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 5  | m1.xlarge | 16384     | 160  | 0         |      | 8     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 84 | m1.micro  | 128       | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+

Change-Id: Idf03d9e8e2086b24b06047309f2f1d72bb26d41d
Closes-Bug: #1259262

commit_message:
Remove outdated libvirt_vif_driver settings

There is no longer a need to modify the libvirt_vif_driver conf
setting, it should always be the default value of:

libvirt_vif_driver=nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LibvirtGenericVIFDriver

This patch removes any reference to deprecated options for the
libvirt_vif_driver parameter.

Closes-bug #1192833

As a side-effect, this patch removes a section that contains this note:

      <note>
        <para>When using libvirt < 0.9.11, one must also edit
            <filename>/etc/libvirt/qemu.conf</filename>, uncomment the
          entry for 'cgroup_device_acl', add the value '/dev/net/tun'
          to the list of items for the configuration entry, and then
          restart libvirtd.</para>
      </note>

It's not clear to me whether this is required or not with the
generic VIF driver plugin.

Change-Id: I233b18c8021bae6218faee63828c093d9b5b883d
backport: havana

commit_message:
Ignore fewer PEP8/flake8 rules

- code should be pythonicaly clean,
  that is why number of ignored rules should reduced

  H302, F841, H301, H702, H703 rules are now enabled

subject: Oslo sync: make wait/stop funs work on all threads
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7109, 'name': 'Dmitry Mescheryakov (dmitryme)', 'email': 'dmescheryakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dmitryme'}, {'_account_id': 7125, 'name': 'Alexander Ignatov', 'email': 'aignatov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aignatov'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8304, 'name': 'John Speidel', 'email': 'jspeidel@hortonworks.com', 'username': 'jspeidel'}, {'_account_id': 8411, 'name': 'Andrew Lazarev', 'email': 'alazarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'alazarev'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-09 20:59:13.000000000', 'files': ['savanna/openstack/common/threadgroup.py'], 'message': 'Oslo sync: make wait/stop funs work on all threads

Previously, ThreadGroup.wait and ThreadGroup.stop would iterate over
the self.threads list and call the wait or stop method on each one.
This list could potentially be edited concurrently by the _thread_done
callbacks and remove some items in the list.  As a result, the wait
method would not actually wait for all threads in the thread group.

Additionally, vim headers was removed.

Change-Id: I254992b06c24cbf31f02e8f2b29430df57c85da6
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Oslo sync: make wait/stop funs work on all threads

Previously, ThreadGroup.wait and ThreadGroup.stop would iterate over
the self.threads list and call the wait or stop method on each one.
This list could potentially be edited concurrently by the _thread_done
callbacks and remove some items in the list.  As a result, the wait
method would not actually wait for all threads in the thread group.

Additionally, vim headers was removed.

Change-Id: I254992b06c24cbf31f02e8f2b29430df57c85da6

commit_message:
Sync requirements: pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See:

http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I45c59b30b0afd6be8ce94390042f5e75534046bd

Before this, the tests would often fail due to a single second of drift

commit_message:
Use fuzy compare for datetimes in usage tests.

Before this, the tests would often fail due to a single second of drift
from the expected usage time and the actual time in which the event was
recorded in the database. This code allows there to be a small delta of
five seconds between the expected and actual time.

Closes-Bug: 1259298

Change-Id: I51a65f71d2e9cdf5ae0eb10b2f5b207b2d74a80b

Message bus additions for RHEL/CentOS/Fedora distributions

subject: Do not set column values to None explicitly when migrate DB
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-10 01:10:05.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/018_add_qos_specs.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/005_add_source_volume_column.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/006_snapshots_add_provider_location.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/012_add_attach_host_column.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/013_add_provider_geometry_column.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/014_add_name_id.py'], 'message': 'Do not set column values to None explicitly when migrate DB

http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_0_8/core/metadata.html#sqlalchemy.schema.Column

According to above link, when create a column, if did not set the
default value of the column explicitly, then the API will set it
as None by default, so when migrate DB, there is no need to set
new added column values to None.

Change-Id: I595459f13e341e538c2c51d41385e1deb0880ecc
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not set column values to None explicitly when migrate DB

http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_0_8/core/metadata.html#sqlalchemy.schema.Column

According to above link, when create a column, if did not set the
default value of the column explicitly, then the API will set it
as None by default, so when migrate DB, there is no need to set
new added column values to None.

Change-Id: I595459f13e341e538c2c51d41385e1deb0880ecc

commit_message:
Bump grenade master to use stable/havana.

Now that we have cut Havana it is time to move on and use
it (instead of Grizzly) for forward facing Icehouse testing.

This is holding up Nova migration compaction at the moment.

Change-Id: Ib64dafbd3aeb968fb71752a5a26fad105045f5f8

commit_message:
Handle skips because of config in skip_because

This commit adds support to the skip_because decorator to internally
handle config options for skipping. This enables removing all the
calls to TempestConfig() in skip decorators to use that as conditions
for skipping.

Change-Id: Idc610f1910fd46187081a2bef76eb0d383e96611

commit_message:
Replace inheritance hierarchy with composition

In the process of unification of the clients code we should use
composition to allow easier replacement with common HTTPClient.

Related to blueprint common-client-library-2

Change-Id: I1e4ec379e1f6289ed26a5a3157917d3d20a36bd6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-09 20:58:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Sync oslo lockutils for "fix lockutils.lock() to make it thread-safe"

thread-safe" along with dependencies.

Related-Bug: #1065529

Change-Id: Ia3530c0d3e78d90fd6de8ac186b252e0fbbba85e
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-12-09 22:36:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Sync oslo lockutils for "fix lockutils.lock() to make it thread-safe"

Pull in oslo-incubator change Ia18e6e9f "fix lockutils.lock() to make it
thread-safe" along with dependencies.

Note: I've intentionally excluded log.py from the sync since it pulls in
Change Ic2cf3e52: Adding domain to context and log which is (1) unrelated
to the lockutils change and (2) also changes context.py, which lockutils
does not depend on.

Changes by module (from oldest to newest)
=========================================

excutils:

Change Ic36fa050: Enable H302 hacking check
Change Ibf3c56e4: BaseException.message is deprecated since Python 2.6
Change I87fd89ff: excutils: use six.reraise to re-raise
Change If640e551: excutils: replace unicode by six.u
Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

fileutils:

Change Ia51d416b: Add utils for creating tempfile
Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

gettextutils:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

importutils:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

jsonutils:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header
Change I90be8797: Use six.iteritems to make dict work on Python2/3

local:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

lockutils:

Change I64fccddc: Allow lockutils to get lock_path conf from envvar
Change I9e1260e2: Add main() to lockutils that creates temp dir
Change Ia18e6e9f: fix lockutils.lock() to make it thread-safe
Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

timeutils:

Change I397bae40: Add helper method total_seconds in timeutils.py

commit_message:
Sync oslo lockutils for "fix lockutils.lock() to make it thread-safe"

Pull in oslo-incubator change Ia18e6e9f "fix lockutils.lock() to make it
thread-safe" along with dependencies.

Note: I've intentionally excluded log.py from the sync since it pulls in
Change Ic2cf3e52: Adding domain to context and log which is (1) unrelated
to the lockutils change and (2) also changes context.py, which lockutils
does not depend on.

Changes by module (from oldest to newest)
=========================================

excutils:

Change Ic36fa050: Enable H302 hacking check
Change Ibf3c56e4: BaseException.message is deprecated since Python 2.6
Change I87fd89ff: excutils: use six.reraise to re-raise
Change If640e551: excutils: replace unicode by six.u
Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

fileutils:

Change Ia51d416b: Add utils for creating tempfile
Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

gettextutils:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

importutils:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

jsonutils:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header
Change I90be8797: Use six.iteritems to make dict work on Python2/3

local:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

lockutils:

Change I64fccddc: Allow lockutils to get lock_path conf from envvar
Change I9e1260e2: Add main() to lockutils that creates temp dir
Change Ia18e6e9f: fix lockutils.lock() to make it thread-safe
Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

timeutils:

Change I397bae40: Add helper method total_seconds in timeutils.py
Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

Related-Bug: #1065529

Change-Id: Ia3530c0d3e78d90fd6de8ac186b252e0fbbba85e

commit_message:
token provider cleanup

UUID and PKI tokens are peers, and PKI should not be a subclass of
UUID.  This is the start of a cleanup effort to break the Provider
into a pipeline, but done in a way that each change is understandable
on its own.

Change-Id: I0720695b91d20a675374e713fe9ac6c0d7120484

commit_message:
Quota violations should not cause a stacktrace in the logs

Don't show exception logs in api log for resize operations
if the resize operations lead to quota violations

Change-Id: Ia101c599908c7652cc07fa4c7e7f1b057943e031
Closes-Bug: #1235389

commit_message:
Save PKI token in a file for PXE deploy ramdisk

Vendor passthru API should be used for PXE deploy from ramdisk,
but we must have a valid PKI token for authorization. PKI token
saved in a file in the tftp root for further read from the ramdisk.

Change-Id: I8e5f1cf0a0c48874b694f24226613a8db4d49cd1

commit_message:
Use update_task_metadata in set_task_progress

Instead of duplicating logic done for updating
or creating a task details metadata property we
can just use the new update_task_metadata as
the single function that can do this.

Change-Id: I66041a157b3f37ca083f8e743ec348ca8feacac6

commit_message:
Capture task duration

Record how long a task took to execute (or fail)
by adding a new listener (and associated refactoring)
that can be used to record these time statistics in
storage.

blueprint capture-task-duration

Change-Id: I9c556e5dcbad924380ae4b94ffb03bc22edad50a

commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb

commit_message:
Prevent filename truncating when downloading objects with Firefox

Filenames containing blanks get truncated when downloading using
Firefox. Put double quotes around the filename, to ensure it does
not get truncated.

Change-Id: I303c05f4bbf9bf00536442d47a9401c087562dc2
Closes-Bug: #1259610

subject: Make pbr only a build-time dependency.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-09 23:34:10.000000000', 'files': ['marconiclient/version.py'], 'message': "Make pbr only a build-time dependency.

This lets you build python-marconiclient packages that don't require pbr
to be installed at all. You would need pbr on the machine running
rpmbuild / debuild, but not on the machines that install the packages.

Unfortunately, this does not make python-marconiclient able to be
installed via pip 0.3.1 on Lucid; you'll need to uninstall the system
python-pip package and install a new pip some other way. Given that pip
< 1.3 doesn't perform SSL certificate validation for pypi (trivial MITM
attack, anyone?), you'd probably want to get a new pip anyway.

Change-Id: I2fb160b6dd446f1fc72eed2371db1afcb00b9e52
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make pbr only a build-time dependency.

This lets you build python-marconiclient packages that don't require pbr
to be installed at all. You would need pbr on the machine running
rpmbuild / debuild, but not on the machines that install the packages.

Unfortunately, this does not make python-marconiclient able to be
installed via pip 0.3.1 on Lucid; you'll need to uninstall the system
python-pip package and install a new pip some other way. Given that pip
< 1.3 doesn't perform SSL certificate validation for pypi (trivial MITM
attack, anyone?), you'd probably want to get a new pip anyway.

Change-Id: I2fb160b6dd446f1fc72eed2371db1afcb00b9e52

commit_message:
Hide key field in edit Flavor Extra Specs dialog

Nova allow user to add key/value to flavor, but its api is only
able to update value according to key.

Hide the key field in edit dialog, in order to avoid confusion.
User can delete and create new one when need to update "key".

Change-Id: Ibd13bfe8a3832d019d16a39b40f643b860e3c612
Closes-Bug: #1257882

commit_message:
Use code from AdvNetworking for MS SQL Cluster IP validation.

Use code borrowed from murano-conductor for generation of subnets
against which both MS SQL Cluster IPs should be validated (they should
belong to that subnet). Old validation of static IPs is no longer
sufficient because CIDR's are generated by murano-conductor during
deployment.

Valid subnet, once generated in dashboard for validation purposes, is
stored in murano-api environment for later use by murano-conductor
(DRY). Subnet is generated for every new environment, but is used only
during MS SQL Cluster IP validation.

This commit comes in a team with 3 following commits:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59982/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59983/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61072/

Change-Id: I24b3c057fe43e9a35a96ddf2c4defd4f64e9b4ea

commit_message:
XenAPI:  Increase DomU's memory

Devstack has been increasing in complexity, and if we use too
much of our memory it can lead to fragmentation which in turn
causes a DomU error and a failure of random tests.

Change-Id: Ide9cc84625caed4e35a64a47ee1e92a6cd567651

commit_message:
Race condition in ListImageFilters tests

The server may not have moved back to ACTIVE state for
a short period after the image has been successfully
uploaded - so wait for the server to be ACTIVE
before continuing with the tests

Change-Id: I2d471c83d902a408004a4b2ccb8b42fdfcd764b0
Closes-bug: 1258635

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-29 06:53:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Specify tenant_id when retrieving LBaaS/VPNaaS resource

In Neutron API, resources from all tenants are listed when
retrieving a list of resources with admin role. Horizon
project dashboard is for project-specific operations,
so we should retrieve only resources of the given project.
LBaaS/VPNaaS panels have this problem, but FWaaS does not.

This commit also fixes FWaaS tests so that it extract tenant_id
from request attribute rather than use tenant_id of test_data.

Change-Id: I080e6c6d1e426a878c1d088763bbc7e5add15820
Closes-Bug: #1244126

commit_message:
Specify tenant_id when retrieving LBaaS/VPNaaS resource

In Neutron API, resources from all tenants are listed when
retrieving a list of resources with admin role. Horizon
project dashboard is for project-specific operations,
so we should retrieve only resources of the given project.
LBaaS/VPNaaS panels have this problem, but FWaaS does not.
router_list should be called with tenant_id filter too.

This commit also fixes VPN/FWaaS tests so that it extract tenant_id
from request attribute rather than use tenant_id of test_data.

Change-Id: I080e6c6d1e426a878c1d088763bbc7e5add15820
Closes-Bug: #1244126

commit_message:
Libvirt:Instance resize confirm issue against NFS

when I test resize-confirm on NFS (KVM) using at least two
compute nodes, OSError will occur when try to cleanup the
backup instance directory and will make instance status
"Error".

One way to cleanup resize is using delay_on_retry and
maximum attempts setting. Replace rmtree() because
execute() have more parameters choices.

Closes-Bug: #1248019

Change-Id: Ifb9a500bbba805af0317307c2e7d6903dcd02ad1

commit_message:
Raise better exception if duplicate security groups

Previously a 500 error was raised if one was trying to launch an instance
with a security group that shared the same name as another security group.
With this patch a more clear error message is raised.

Closes-bug: #1161472

Change-Id: I285bedbb2e0b3f4cd24cfa3a9b17131ad0200afa

commit_message:
Tempest should be configured with upgrade projects only

This avoid problems try to test projects that are enabled by devstack in the
gate but are not upgraded with grenade.

Change-Id: I7490e88352cdb2afcd3806cc4f62991ae2b43c5c

commit_message:
Modify upgrade-* scripts to allow skip configuration if not needed

This allow grenade to move and test from a brand new release to master without
any change.

This way it allows to enable d-g grenade testing new-release->master where for
a just released Openstack means that we don't need any new configuration yet.

Change-Id: I3e685deb61b95116420eae9cacb6b38dc405ffe9

start up a configurable (workers=??) number of child processes which
will all listen on the bind port.  The main process becomes the parent
and manages the children.  The parent is not a worker.

commit_message:
Creates multiple worker processes for API server

This change to the WSGI code uses openstack.common.service to create
multiple worker processes to handle API load.  The main process will
start up a configurable (workers=??) number of child processes which
will all listen on the bind port.  The main process becomes the parent
and manages the children.  The parent is not a worker.

Backwards compatibility is preserved by setting api_workers to 0, the
default.  In this case, no separate worker processes are spawned and
the worker threads run in the main process.

Implement blueprint multi-workers-for-api-server

Change-Id: Iffa76041d0055840ccca852814b0e71f17a950ac

commit_message:
Plugin-based dashboard configuration

This is a proof of concept of how plugin-based configuration of
OpenStack dashboards could be realized. Additional plugins add
their configuration file in the opestack_dashboard/enabled/
directory (the exact location is up for discussion, we will
probably want a whole hierarchy of locations, with the possibility
of overriding settings).

An example file _50_tuskar.py is added to show how an additional
dashboard could plug into this system. If you have tuskar_ui installed,
this would add Tuskar to Horizon.

Change-Id: Iaa594deffbdb865116f6f62855c32c8633d2b208
Implements: blueprint plugin-architecture

commit_message:
Fix violations of H302:import only modules

Comment '# noqa' was missed in some files, led to pep8 warning.
And some modules imported non-module. This patch fixes them.
This is output of violation:
http://logs.openstack.org/77/60977/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/4a00515/

Change-Id: Id79bca9820853ecd9f0660a855d7bb2fe42ec806

commit_message:
Add architecture field in image properties.

It would be beneficial for us to be able to add architecture
to the image file, and we already have an architecture field
on update Image dialog.

commit_message:
AccountController now uses cache for HEAD requests (WIP)

Account header informations are pushed to caches
once account storage server has been requested.
This patch allow the proxy server to use
that cached headers for HEAD request on accounts.

Change-Id: I618866ba4a8cd189a643153c1fb8e5a1deb37616
Implements: Blueprint swift-account-head-caching

    As long as Horizon does not support any browser lower than IE8,
json2.js library is no longer needed, browsers have a native
implementation of JSON.stringify and JSON.parse.
    Removing this script allow us to reduce the javascript footprint
of Horizon.
    jQuery $.parseJSON will replace all parsing of JSON in order to
standardize the use of this functionnality.

Change-Id: Ifaf027e2adc462ee7b3d9587b28583ade376ccfc
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Removal of json2.js

    As long as Horizon does not support any browser lower than IE8,
json2.js library is no longer needed, browsers have a native
implementation of JSON.stringify and JSON.parse.
    Removing this script allow us to reduce the javascript footprint
of Horizon.
    jQuery $.parseJSON will replace all parsing of JSON in order to
standardize the use of this functionnality.

Change-Id: Ifaf027e2adc462ee7b3d9587b28583ade376ccfc

subject: Fix URLs of panels grouped into packages
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-10 08:42:41.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/base.py'], 'message': 'Fix URLs of panels grouped into packages

If you group related panels into packages using the
dot notation, the URLs generated for them will have
the dot in them where you would rather expect a
slash. This patch fixes it by replacing the dots in
the panel slug with slashes when generating URLs for
them.

Change-Id: I450321f2c2a64297fbd3e1104ad5635aa5d9aba8
Closes-bug: #1259458
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix URLs of panels grouped into packages

If you group related panels into packages using the
dot notation, the URLs generated for them will have
the dot in them where you would rather expect a
slash. This patch fixes it by replacing the dots in
the panel slug with slashes when generating URLs for
them.

Change-Id: I450321f2c2a64297fbd3e1104ad5635aa5d9aba8
Closes-bug: #1259458

commit_message:
Set can_set_mount_point default to False

Patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59229/ only changed the default
value in the local_settings.py example file. If the setting isn't defined,
it still defaults to True

Change-Id: Ia3525786e5eb9ec83b8057c1cb6158ab153adc59
Closes-Bug: #1255136

commit_message:
Nova Aggregate wrapper to manage host allocation pools

Proxy interface for managing AZs or Pclouds in the
next future

Implements bp:host-reservation-pool

Change-Id: Ife4949896c1679c941df5b7059a8fbcbf55ec287

[{'created': '2013-12-09 17:25:58.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/api/v1/images.py'], 'message': 'Enforce copy_from policy during image-update

commit_message:
Enforce copy_from policy during image-update

The enforcement of the copy_from policy is missing during update allowing
every user to do this action no matter what is defined in the policy.json

Change-Id: Iecf11bdf220b37d9ecbb6fc686214d14acf1d3dd
Closes-bug: #1259241
